review_title: Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, dynamic duo.
review_detailed_main:
They are two worst filmmakers in filming history. And they work together!!!!! Why? Whyyyy? They have written and directed films such as "Date Movie", "Epic Movie", "Meet the Spartans", "Disaster Movie" and "Vampires Suck". And they work together on "The Biggest Movie of All Time 3D". It will be adventure/comedy. Right? It will be released in 2012. Wow. The Biggest Movie of All Time? And in 3D? Wow again.

Sometimes I even like parodies. There are plenty great parodies out there. But this films are simply idiotic. I watched "Disaster Movie" till the end on. I knew it will be extremely stupid, but really I didn't expected this.

I was thinking: Finally!!! "Disaster Movie" will be disaster for their careers. They will try to made something else with their lives. But nooo... they did it again, and again.

Please someone stop them. Or just shot them.

To think this movie was called 'Disaster Movie', because of 'all the parodies on disaster movies', is a mistake. This movie is called that way, because the movie itself is a disaster.

From the moment the movie begins, everything the main cast is doing is one long concatenation of silly, overdone parodies on a wide selection of movies. A couple of parodies are okay, but they just keep on coming and even if you think that a parodie is going to stop, so they could continue with 'the story' of the movie...think again. Some parodies are hugely overdone and way too much. And that's not all. What bothers me, is that a lot of the parodies and spoofs are from quite new movies, which are hard to get and left you wondering what the movie was called again that they are spoofing. To spoof instant classics like Star Wars and Indiana Jones is okay, because everyone gets that...but to spoof Zohan and Jimmy Kimmel show (just to name two)...that's just not done.

And the list continues....there are about 60 spoofs and connections with other movies...which are just 50 too many. (I think I could stand 10 spoofs, but not more!).

Verdict: This 'disaster-on-screen' is not worth watching and especially not worth your money if you want to rent it. 2 out of 10. Yes, I gave it a 2 because of the cool metal/hardrock song that's in the movie. Don't watch the movie for that part, it should be on YouTube somewhere. Saves you about an hour of your life.

review_title: A steaming pile of dog pooh would offer more entertainment
review_detailed_main: The title of the film is quite apt here, this is a disaster movie in the sense that it was a disaster that this film was made. This film joins a long list of spoof movies which seem to be getting worse and worse and this one really does scrape the bottom of the barrel. I watched this on the advise of a friend who "pissed his pants" and after watching this I'll be advising he goes to see the doctor about an incontinence problem because this film really is not funny. I feel embarrassed that I watched the film let alone I'm reviewing it. Please take my advise and avoid this film. I can't honesty think of one redeeming feature of the film. This may be the worst film I've reviewed and I can't give it any more than 1 star, in fact doing that felt like I was betraying my integrity. Tomorrow I am going to watch paint dry and grass grow... both of those things offer a lot more excitement, wit, intelligence and appeal. If you get the chance to read through the reviews on this film have a look for peter1-8's review as that pretty much nails my feelings for this film :(

Overall , it was such a horrid movie ... a real Disaster for the art of Cinema indeed !!!

This movie is a joke, yes. Most people do agree that the movie is a joke. Though to me it is a joke in the best sense possible. I understand that most of the jokes aren't really "funny" but the movie is so stupid it feels actually impossible for me to dislike it to the point where I don't like it.

In fact I don't really dislike it at all. The movie is good stupid fun, essentially perfect in that way.

How can anybody enjoy these? The directors of this movie were so bad that they were ripping off movies that were still in theaters! That's the lamest idea I've ever heard. review_title: Never has a movie been more appropriately titled
review_detailed_main: The aptly titled "Disaster Movie" is 90 minutes of one long painfully unfunny joke without a punchline. It plays out like a series of cutaway gags from Family Guy, only they last way too long and never cut away.
It's bad. It's not funny. It's lazy. If you want comedy, watch Dumb and Dumber

review_title: Cringe worthy jokes are used as padding between scenes of a pointless pot.
Look on the bright side, It can't be any worse then this
Best movie I have ever seen, hands down.
review_detailed_main:
Where do I even begin with The Disaster Movie? It's a cinematic gem, a true masterpiece that defies the conventions of good taste and storytelling. Move over, Citizen Kane; there's a new sheriff in town.

Firstly, let's talk about the groundbreaking script. It's so innovative, so ahead of its time, that it throws away the notion of coherence altogether. Who needs a logical plot when you can cram as many pop culture references and toilet humor into 90 minutes? It's like the writers played Mad Libs with a bunch of random movie titles and said, "Yep, that's our plot."

The character development in this film is simply unparalleled. I've never seen characters so one-dimensional, and it's genuinely refreshing. It's like the actors decided to embrace their lack of depth and just roll with it. Who cares about emotional arcs when you can have characters who exist solely for cheap laughs and cringe-worthy parodies?

The special effects, oh my, let's not even get started on the groundbreaking CGI that rivals the best of the '90s. Forget about Avatar; The Disaster Movie gives you visuals that will make you question the very fabric of reality. The green screen work is so avant-garde that you'll think you're watching a live performance at your local community theater.

And the jokes. Oh, the jokes. They're so brilliantly unfunny that they loop around and become comedic gold. Who needs wit and clever writing when you can have the comedic finesse of a third-grader armed with a whoopee cushion and a rubber chicken?

In conclusion, The Disaster Movie is a triumph of bad taste, an opus of cinematic catastrophe that will leave you questioning your very understanding of what constitutes a good film. Move over, Academy Awards; this is the true definition of a masterpiece. Bravo, Disaster Movie, bravo.

I wanted to rate it 12/10 but sadly I don't have the option.
Oh my god, this film is bad. It's full of cliches and atrocious acting. DO NOT WATCH

review_title: I hated every second of it

The actors do theirs to make this movie worse than any movie you would ever watch (possibly for the rest of your life). But they are not fully to blame, the directing of the movie, along with the manuscript makes it a nearly impossible task for any actor to preform well. This movie is completely awful. The humour reaches a point where one can describe it as worse than childish. The actors untalented, or unwilling to even try and the parody parts are just too offensive and unfunny to be even considered parody. There's absolutely no point in watching that movie. I would only beg the producers and the director to stop wasting money for making this kind of rubbish. There are a lot of good movies made with half the budget 'Disaster Movie' had. I advise you not to watch it ever. Don't waste your time on this movie. Is mocking a dwarf funny? Or humiliating a troubled singer with addiction? No. It is absolutely not. I finished watching this title and i felt really sorry for Nicole Parker. She has the only few enjoyable seconds with her impressions, in this huge load of farts-puke-underwear-awful-parodies that Disaster movie is. I really don't know how these guys get their scripts thumbed up. And really don't know what these guys feel for the comedy genre., i'm seriously thinking that they probably hate it.

Seltzler or whatever his name is and the other guy, should go and sell hot dogs for a living.

review_title: It really lives up to its reputation and it's even worse!!!
review_detailed_main:
This film has a reputation of being one of the worst movies ever made. It always sat in the Bottom 100 (and today is #1!!!), it has thousands of negative reviews and it has been aired rarely on TV. But as you might have noticed, I am quite a glutton for punishment that would even watch the most wretched movies of all time, and it was reason enough few months ago for finally watching it. Now I can go to the review.

The movie begins with a scene parodying 10,000 AC where a caveman is squashed by a mammoth and then dragged on a pile of Mammoth fecal matter. Then he is attacked by a guy from AMERICAN GLADIATORS and an Amy Winehouse clone with fangs. Then he awakens and he has strange encounters with a dwarf and various celebrity clones. And basically, this is the rest of the movie. Countless parodys after another after another after another... and none of them made me even snicker!

Most of the scenes were so random that you might wonder if the director gave directions or they just signed on a piece of paper some ideas and they used them in the way they wanted. Many of the jokes fell flat, and it was obvious that nobody wasn't even trying. Not even the various characters parodied in it (like Batman, Iron Man, Hellboy, Po the panda) couldn't save this disaster of a movie (at least the title is right). I have personally seen many movies with bad acting, and I can say that the acting here was too much to stomach even for me! I really can't think at this moment of a comedy that didn't make me laugh through the beginning to the end (apart from CAT IN THE HAT and BABY GENIUSES) but I have to put this at the top of the list.

I really agree with 99% of the reviews here that this is only an esecrable excuse for making cheap laughs. It's crass, revolting, dumb (and I felt a bit stupider after it was finally over!), unfunny, horribly acted, horribly written, horribly directed and badly made that it looked like it was recut and pasted various times. If you want to watch a comedy that makes fun of other movies, avoid at all costs this one!!! I would rather gouge my eyes with my fingernails than re-watch this atrocity AGAIN!

review_title: So abysmal that I refused to give this movie a score.
review_detailed_main:
I don't think I should call it a movie, it doesn't even deserve that word 'movie'. It's more like something that even the devil didn't liked, and it's obviously Friedburg and Seltzer's own Frankenstein monster to just pull in all the moviegoers and general audiences to see this 'thing', I'll call it a 'thing' for now. However, the audience were too smart to not see this monstrosity because they know that the twin clowns were treated them like they're brain dead (Date Movie and Meet The Spartans are good examples of this), and that's why it tanked at the box office but I don't blame the audience for that, at all.

And what I meant by 'Frankenstein monster', I meant that there's not a single reference or a gag that really work, or it just that it was made by a bunch of monkeys. The references are lazy, insulting, stupid and tiresome, the production value looks like it has a fungus growing on it, the visuals look incredibly cheap, the acting is beyond terrible, and the 'writing' is abysmal. There's nothing to say about it what it's already been said. And I wish that Friedburg and Seltzer will be disappeared from this universe because stuff like this should never exist.

This may be a shocker to you but you know what, I'll rather watch Battlefield Earth over and over again than seeing or even hearing about this thing ever againg. It doesn't deserve any number other than a zero, heck it doesn't even desrve a '1 star out of 10' at all.

Score: 0/10

review_title: Probably the worse movie I've seen
are you kidding!!!! you guys don't know cinematic brilliance
review_detailed_main:
This movie was absolutely incredible. I love the way the juxtaposition in the cinematic technique experience highlighted the portrayal of the fat chicks dignity in such an extraordinarily derogatory manner. i mean this was one the best movies I've ever seen, and that include revenge of the nerds 4. If i wasn't so interested in catching butterflies and using them as chips when i play no limit Texas hold em, then i would quit my day job as a professional scat artist (not the jazz kind) and become the films executive producer, and ensure that this will at least have 4 very similar in storyline sequels.

Many thanks, with all my love in devotion. Timothy Michael Parfitt hugs and kisses :) <3

review_title: This is a warning to stay away. Please.
review_detailed_main:
I'm going to start off my review saying that I don't normally give movies 1 star. I'm not one of those people that goes around giving a 1 to any movie that I even sort of disliked. Nay, to get a 1 on my scale, a movie has to be truly awful. And this... this is.

Sitting through the movie is literally painful. Each cheap scatological joke and celebrity reference is like a stab to the chest, and by 10 minutes in, that's about 82,000 stabs to the chest. The movie eats away at you, until you're actually considering killing yourself to stop the pain that you're in. Every minute, it just gets worse and worse, until you're ready to smash your head through the TV you're watching it on.

But, I was saved. After what felt like eight hours of mind-bogglingly bad "jokes", my DVD player shut down, saying it was "unable to read disc". Now, normally, I would be angry, restart the DVD player, and watch from the scene it shut down on. But, this... this had to be a sign. The DVD player had to be saving me the agony of the last few minutes of this awful thing that they pass off as a film. After a few minutes of thanking my DVD player, I decided it was my mission to get on any site I could and warn people to get as far as possible away from any copy of "Disaster Movie" you see.

Seriously. In the hour or so I sat through, there was not one joke. No, there were only cheap knockoffs of celebrities and movie characters, agonizingly long dance scenes and burp jokes, and "kicked in the nuts" scenes.

And it's not just the "humor" that's bad about this movie. Every aspect of the movie is so despicably awful, I would expect better film-making from an amnesiac turtle that had climbed on top of a video camera and accidentally turned it on. I don't expect Oscar-winning performances in these things, but oh my god. I've sat through movies like "Suburban Sasquatch" (watch some clips) and even the acting in that seems better in comparison. The actors being passed off as characters and celebrities are god-awful and do not share a remote resemblance to the people they're pretending to be. Seriously, I would have no idea who they were if the directors didn't point it out to me at least three times during the joke. "Hey look, it's Wolf from American Gladiators". Alright, it's Wolf. "Yes, that's right, I'm Wolf from American Gladiators". Alright... we get it. But, then they repeat the fact that it's Wolf from American Gladiators over and over and over until you're just about ready to scream at the screen, "WE GET IT, GET ON WITH IT!" I could go on and on about how bad this movie was. I could go on and on about how many times they shove the same joke down your throat time and time again (saying Juno talks strange every time she says a sentence is NOT funny). I could complain about the special effects. Or the costumes. Or the fact that they still think Michael Jackson jokes are funny. Or the fact that they actually take jokes word-for-word from other movies and pass them off as their own. Or I could complain about the sad state of comedy, and how angry it makes me that hordes of high teenagers think this is funny. But I won't.

Because I figure they put so little work into this piece of trash, I should put even less work into writing my review. I BEG of you, do not buy, rent or come near "Disaster Movie". Because if it makes more money, they'll make more of them. And soon, after "Twilight Movie" and "Movie Movie", BAM our society will look like it did in "Idiocracy". Do you want to cause the end of civilization as we know it? No? Well, then don't give Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg a cent of your hard-earned money. DON'T SEE DISASTER MOVIE.

And to people that say "well, you didn't see the whole movie, you can't review it", you obviously haven't seen it. They were "parodying" movies that HAD NOT EVEN COME OUT YET. So, if they can watch trailers of upcoming movies, retread the jokes and call it a movie, I can watch most of the movie, rant about it, and call it a review. I'm done. This movie makes me mad.

I don't know what is with these people. The people that made this movie have bad taste. These people would make fun of really awesome people by making them look like geeks and weirdos. One question I want to ask is Why? Why did the actors even want to be in the movie. I think it's because the actors have bad taste too. Is it possible to rate below 0? I wanted to rate this a negative 10. This was overall just beyond stupid. I am warning you now, whatever you do, don't watch this movie ever! I would rather encounter the joker, have him give me an overdose of his joker toxin and take me to the top of mount everest and throw me down.

review_title: I could put up a spoiler warning but the real spoiler is if you watch this crap.
review_detailed_main:
Disaster Movie is a bad, bad movie. Throughout the whole movie I just wanted it to end, but me and my pal had agreed before watching to see if anything funny came at all. It didn't. Are these supposed to be parodies? Not a single one of these parodies made me laugh. This surrounded by a plot that makes the Flashdance-plot look as deep as Schindlers list. Epic Movie had the Chronicles of Narnia, Meet the Spartans had 300, this movie has nothing. That's probably the best definition of this movie, it's nothing, absolutely nothing. Out of all the movies that came out from 2007-2008, they really couldn't think of one disaster movie to have the movie be a main parody of? I Am Legend and Cloverfield came out during the same time these other movies parodied came out. It would've some sort of sense if they made fun of either of those movies. Not a single disaster movie is parodied in a movie ironically called Disaster movie. The acting, forget about it. The writing, forget about it. Originally there were a few things that were actually cool in the movie the first time I saw them. They were the cat fight between Kim Kardashian and Carmen Electra, and the song towards the end of the movie. Now that I think of that, they sucked just as much as this movie. Even they're not even good, you'll probably get more laughs out of any Scary Movie movie than in this hour and a half of laugh-free pain and agony.

review_title: Truly, pathetically, bizarrely awful. But we can learn from it.
review_detailed_main:
OK, let's get it out of the way early: this movie is truly bad. Granted, I didn't think it was as bad as 'Epic Movie,' but that may just be because I had not seen the equal of 'Epic Movie' in a long time ('Chairman of the Board' springs to mind). But don't think I am praising it: 'Epic Movie' was a pile of dog excrement. 'Disaster Movie' is tinsel in the dog excrement: shinier, a little more attractive, but in the end, pretty much just as disgusting.

For those who don't know, the plot of this tripe is, essentially, several fairly attractive young people try to make it through a Friedberg/Seltzer movie with their careers intact. Unfortunately, no one's does, which is a bit of a shame: Carmen Electra, for her crazy past, certainly deserves a lot better, and the only real bright spot of the film, the deadpan work by Ike Barinholtz of Mad TV fame (who had the only semi-decent line in 'Meet the Spartans') is underpinned by a boatload of utter nonsense. Attempts to further the plot are foiled by an endless stream of pop culture references that are not only unfunny, but have nothing to do with anything that happens on screen. And just in case you aren't laughing at a joke (believe me, it will be through no fault of your own), the filmmakers make absolutely certain you know exactly what they are referencing and why you should find it funny.

But all is not lost. Thankfully, even the worst movies can teach us a thing or two about what works and what doesn't. Since this movie has shown that some people clearly haven't learned them (and budding filmmakers, take note), let's print a few here:

1. IN COMEDY, TIMING IS EVERYTHING. Somehow, cosmically, every joke has its one point where it switches from 'ho-hum' to 'gutbuster.' Some jokes take longer, some shorter. But playing a 1 second joke for 5 minutes does not work. For reference, see much of this movie.

2. EDITING IS CRUCIAL. Similar to #1 in idea, but different in execution. One of the questions the movie asks is, 'Why not use five gags to make one joke?' The reason: four of the gags are not funny, and by the time the fifth rolls around, the joke falls flat on its face. I really think some of the gags in the movie could work if some editing was done. Unfortunately, this would most likely reduce the running time considerably...say, to about 27 minutes or so.

3. DON'T INSULT THE AUDIENCE. Toilet humor is perfectly fine for a movie, especially a parody film. I can laugh at pretty much anything. But as I mentioned above, I don't laugh when I'm told by the movie why this scene is supposed to be funny, and that I should laugh specifically because it told me I should. I liked 'Superhero Movie,' because as incredibly stupid and silly as it was, it never once told me to laugh at something; it let me decide. 'Disaster Movie' never gives you the option. Every joke is carefully (and sometimes, quite thoroughly) explained, to the point where I wanted to shout out, "All right! I get it, but I don't like it!"

4. SEQUELS AND SPIN-OFFS ARE WRITTEN THROUGH DOLLARS. Any dollar spent at the local theater, rental store, or on-line distributor is a vote for that film. If you don't like something, for Pete's sake, don't spend your hard-earned money on it. And tell your friends not to see it. It would appear after 'Disaster,' the audience is finally starting to speak where it counts the most.

No movie is completely without fans. If you liked 'Disaster Movie,' then you liked it. But please, keep it to yourself. I've painfully sat through the last three Seltzer/Friedberg movies so others wouldn't have to. Do not make my sacrifice in vain.

from the comedy aspect (the genre it is accidentally addressed to) it was even worse than "Meet the Spartans" and the...forgot the name of that movie.. it was about..o, remembered! - "dragonfly". So - about comedy aspect - there is none... or one. I had something similar to a laugh just once while watching the movie, once!! this is a new anti-record for these type of movies. I am really waiting in excitement what will be the next BIG THING that Hollyywood will bring in this terrible-parody sub genre (i am not kidding, for real!) So that's about the comedy aspect of "Disaster Movie" (this is where it got it's 0.5 mark out of 10).

now to the positive thing i mentioned in the headline - this movie can be used as a reference guide to the top hit movies of this year and those that can be put on to-watch list. It's more like an hour long ad, than a movie. And some parody scenes are quite good example/interpretations of pop-life based events for the last-and-past years. And this is where it gets another mark - i even give one whole point out of 10 (now totaling 1,5/10).

Thrully disastrous movie, but it's what you asked for if you wanted to watch it ;)

PS. where did it get the last 0.5points? for the ending song which is a rather good parody for the default pop songs that engulf the charts.

review_title: worst film ever made. without exception
This movie made me give up on life
review_detailed_main:
I went to see this film hoping that it would be so bad that I would actually find it funny (like Battlefield Earth), however this film ended up being so horrifically bad that words cannot describe this how this bile made me feel.

A film that uses its 100% of its 90mins to reference things that have happened in American pop culture, and being from the UK I had no idea as to what half the gags were about! No plot, no funny jokes, just an empty shell of a movie. It's upsetting that this pile of crap is allowed to be released into mainstream cinemas.

The film cost $25M to make, and so far has only raked in $12M, WELL DONE EVERYBODY! Hitting the studios in the pockets is the only way that these 2 will get no finance to make more movies.

review_title: Well, the name of the movie says it all...
review_detailed_main: It's bad it's actually a disaster, and the director understands that...

review_title: This movie is how i got the bullet hole in my head
review_detailed_main:
I have at least 10 other movies that i need to review. But this one seems to be easiest to write about before i go see another movie. Comedy has taken a turn for the worse. Thankfully there doesn't seem to be anymore Seltzer/Friedberg trash coming out anytime soon so i'm happy. Luckily there are comedies like Forgetting Sarah Marshall that keeps the comedy genre from dying.

Just like with every Seltzer/Friedberg movie there are jokes that just won't quit. They just go on and on. That is part of the movies problem. I only laughed a few times but that wasn't enough to save this movie. It's just as bad as the other's

1. Meet the Spartans

2. Disaster Movie

3. Date Movie

4. Epic Movie

Of course i don't recommend it. Hopefully this is the end of the Seltzer/Friedberg spoof movies but unfortunately i think there is more to come. May the movie god help us all. I give Disaster Movie...

2/10

review_title: It's not very good, but it's not as bad as they say
review_detailed_main: It's stupid, fun and funny, like Spaceballs, but not as good. I don't think they were trying to beat Spaceballs or Scary Movie, or any of the better ones of that type, I think it's more of a spoof of spoofs. Like, maybe it wasn't really making fun of the movies it parodied, maybe it was making fun of the other spoof movies that spoof such movies as those. Like it's mocking them, like "Hey spoof movies, this is how pointless and nonsensical you are". If that's the case, then it's actually clever. If that's not the case, then it's just a phoned-in formulaic project that was lazily thrown together. Still better than watching paint dry. And for any movie, even a movie of paint drying, to be rated lower than The Last Jedi is an injustice.

review_title: Pure crap. Such a waste of everything.
review_detailed_main: OMG. I got this as part of a 4 pack of similar movies (so no - I did not purposefully purchase it for its own merit). It was the worst of the lot. I want my $2.50 back. This movie is so bad it's not worth the disc it came on (25¢?). I think this is honestly the single worst travesty I have seen and it doesn't deserve to be called a movie. A high school drama class with a vidcam could do a better job. The 'plot' is non-existent. It doesn't even parody disaster movies, but rather just jumbles in EVERY type of movie that has been popular with teens for about the last 5 years. It just steals everything from movies that were good, puts them in a blender, hits TURBO, and then pours the resulting spew into your eyes and ears. The actors are all a bunch of nobody wannabes with utterly stupid dialog. Bottom line - this is total garbage and should have killed dead the 'careers' of everyone involved. Don't waste your time. There is nothing good, funny, whatever about this movie.

review_title: Disaster by name, DISASTER by nature
review_detailed_main: Disaster Movie is supposed to be a 'comedy' feature film. It is agony to say this film possesses any humour whatsoever. 90 minutes of sheer torture. For the sake of your sanity, don't waste your money on going to see this terrible film. Disaster films should be about just that - disasters - and this film certainly lives up to its name - DISASTER. It is nothing more than a 'copy and paste' hash of other movies that bares no relevance to the title. The more people who boycott such films will send a clear message to the studios that we'd rather spend our money on going to see a film that's worth paying for. Hit them in their wallets and they'll soon get the message.

Well, let me start by saying its a damn shame that IMDb doesn't allow a 0 rating- there has never been a stronger contender in my opinion. The mere fact that this movie has been produced is a testament to the idea that there are actually idiots born every second. It's upsetting to think that the makers of this horrific film must be making a profit to keep creating this bile. I think that it shows how bad this film is when i look back on watching it and feel Carmen Electra lowered herself from Meet the Spartans by appearing in this film. Whats really shameful, on top of all other factors, is that the best joke with this apparent 'comedy' is the irony found in the title where the movie itself is described rather than the events that follow.

As a small time movie producer adviser, most movies that was made were made in a hurry. That means the story was written on the fly. Xanadu was one disaster where the writing occurred only after the movie was produced. Then there is political war where the head of the production team or director calls all the shots and the argument about production deadlines. Sure there are deadlines, if you got a good script. Things kind of get out of hand when it becomes a dictatorship during movie production. The only way to prevent this is they have to first get a good title, which they did. Second a good premise to the movie (a believable one). Third a good plot outline, which they did to an extent. Next step is the storyboard which they skipped. Then there's the most important make or break editing, which they skipped almost entirely. A lot of scenes of the movie which is roughly 1 hour and 28 minutes if we just eliminated those scenes that didn't relate to the story line a lot goes down the trash. Therefore why you won't like the movie has a lot to do with the fact that almost the entire movie had nothing to do with the disaster. The disaster only took less then 5 minutes of the entire movie's one hour and a half. Scenes relating to disaster or near that took about 20 minutes. The rest of the bulk are scenes you wouldn't want to watch anyway. These are the scenes that should have been removed because it had nothing to do with the movie: 1,000,000 B.C. scene, Woman vampire singing with the caveman, Chipmunks singing Christmas Music, Pregnant Teenager scenes can be eliminated entirely, the guru in a marriage ceremony completely remove, a long 15 minute teen party can be removed completely - had absolutely nothing to do with disasters, Hannah Montana scene, Woman Wrestlers, Tennis Shoe Telepone, Enchanted princess. Now what's missing is the Disaster movie Genre that has not even been shown: Day After Tomorrow, Al Gore (Global Warming), 2012, Nostradamus, Merlin the Magician, Mother Shipton, History Channel, Poseidon, War of the Worlds, Armageddon, Sinking of Japan, for example were not parodied at all. The basic theme of the movie is the core that keeps the entire genre in one piece isn't even in there or can't be seen, which should follow more closely, for example Day After Tomorrow, and from there we throw in Twisters, Tsunamis, and other genre together. and perhaps the movie's ending should be something akin to there's no end of the world, so the schedule is move up to another date,as in Jehovah's witness. Basically the production house has forgotten a few principles, one major one is unavoidable: the movie before any production should be limited to a small play before a live audiences, as in High school or other appropriate place to get people's response before going any further. It won't cost much. So why has Disney made so many home runs? Simple: it required them a year to write a good story before production even starts. The one major mistake is that they simply allow scenes totally unrelated to the title of the movie. The second mistake is they fail to parody disasters. Sure they may have parody some movie characters, but it was unrelated to the disaster movie genre. So before making a movie, they simply need to compile the list of DISASTER MOVIES that needed to be parodied. But the main focus of a success is actually the organization. If the story process is not democratically decide, it's going to fail because the market is basically decided democratically. The more the people like the better the box office. Schedules of writing should not be part of the production process, otherwise the deadlines simply kill the story. And there's plenty of writers we can find over the net to make a good story anyway. So why put writing team as part of the production schedule? You don't need to. Just get a small competition and then use those materials.

review_title: No story and not that funny
review_detailed_main: Disaster Movie was not very good at all. The movie was a little below average. The movie gives you pretty much what you would expect. It had a couple laughs here and there. No major laugh out loud scenes in the movie though. I didn't think that it was better than all the other spoof movies that are out there. It had no story at all throughout the movie. The acting was alright but nothing special. This movie does make fun of pretty much any movie you can possibly think of that came out this year or late last year. The movie was pretty entertaining though. If you want to go see this movie though wait for a cheap show. It was not worth paying to go see this movie. Overall not that good of a comedy movie. There are better spoof movies. All and all save your money on this one.

review_title: A real disaster of a film but better than a natural one
review_detailed_main:
STAR RATING: ***** Saturday Night **** Friday Night *** Friday Morning ** Sunday Night * Monday Morning

Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer hardly have a Jerry Zucker or Pat Proft talent for spoofery, but someone keeps giving them money to churn out these desperate and unfunny send ups of films. Here, they aim at modern 'disaster' movies such as Cloverfield, and other none disaster related films like Juno, The Chronicles of Narnia, No Country for Old Men and superhero films (which was already done earlier in the year!) like Iron Man, Hellboy 2 and The Dark Knight. While it doesn't do a particularly better job of it than that film, at least the send ups here of these films are a bit more recent and relevant and not just on Spiderman all the time. Some care seems to have gone into the Hellboy and IM costumes, so it's weird how sloppy and awful the Batman costume is. Likewise, a lot of the actors playing the roles look nothing like who they're supposed to be playing, so it's hard to crack a smile at their material. The makers, in all fairness, have been very thorough and have been sure to send everything they can think up, so it's even more of a big blow that hardly any of it is funny at all, least of all an unpleasant scene involving chewing glass. I was tempted to walk out at least once, but I did chuckle once or twice so maybe you will too. **

I saw this at the cinemas last week, and i'm seriously considering going to see it at LEAST 3 more times. It's hilarious! The Princess was my favourite and so was Batman. It was funny all the way through it! So many spoofs. The songs are awesome and the characters are very charming and clever. If you like hilariously funny movies... watch this one. You won't be disappointed. If you are a person who is up to date with Hollywood and the latest movies, you will find this funny and get all the jokes. There are some sad parts but mostly funny. I hope they keep making funny movies like this forever. And Remember... all the most funniest movies end in "movie" like Scary movie, date movie, superhero movie, epic movie, and Disaster movie.

review_title: At least I didn't pay to see it.
review_detailed_main:
I actually got paid while I saw it on a slow night at work. I still feel cheated. The whole thing is on youtube in case you have temporarily lost all respect for yourself or just want to see if a movie can be this bad. I did not actually laugh once. At one point I chuckled at something. I think it was that a man was playing horse-faced Sarah Jessica Parker in one scene. And that was pretty much it.

You know a movie is bad when Vanessa Minillo and Kim Kardashian should actually be ashamed of being in it. Kim K. has been in porn with more depth than this. The pictures of Vanessa Minillo and Lindsay Lohan holding knives to each other's throats is infinitely more interesting than this stupid movie. Maybe it would have helped if I were a teenager, but sadly enough I still got almost every reference they were going for. And none of it was funny. At least we can all rest easy that these two directors currently have no projects listed as being in production. This film appeared to have lost money while their others actually turned a profit. Perhaps they can fool the general public no longer. Here's a thought.... next time something like this comes out that you folks know will be bad, DO NOT PAY TO GO SEE IT! And if you have a friend who insists on dragging you to this crap, you need to get some new friends. 1 of 10 stars.

The Hound.

review_title: Good news, its better than Meet the Spartans. Bad news its still a pile of garbage
review_detailed_main:
Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans and Superhero Movie, three movies with two things in common. They were all made by somebody with something or other to do with Scary Movie, you know those reasonably amusing spoofs that were good fun before they exhausted the franchised long ago. And the fact that all three of them are steaming piles of garbage with out a giggle, a smirk or even a roll of the eye obviously funny between them. To be fair Superhero Movie wasn't horrendous, it was just bland and uninspired, however Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans are the two worst movies I have ever seen. Spartans particularly being so bad that I really did almost walk out. The first trailers for Disaster Movie looked worse than Spartans, in fact when I first saw the trailer I was horrified. Then it got released, destroyed by the critics and I assumed I would never have to watch it. Alas my friends forced me to see it, and now I sit before you about to say something I never thought I would say. Disaster Movie is not the worst movie ever made! In fact in terms of quality its at least three times as good as Spartans. A shame to say a lump of dog poop is three times better than Spartans, so we aren't exactly talking quality. Disaster Movie is better than Spartans because its spoofs at times can be reasonably smirksome, nothing will make you laugh, but there are a few clever quotes here and there. Still it really is a bad movie, the jokes most of them time are just obvious references, most introductions of a spoof begin with the line "look its (insert celebrity name here)", and then we get to watch that celebrity either get hit, fall over or get poo wiped on there face, in some circumstances all three at once. The jokes are hardly inspired either, the Sex and the City joke just being a disaster (no pun intended), and why bother doing the exact same foot scene from Zohan when it was a lot funnier in Zohan? Thankfully the Alvin sequence sort of redeems it a bit, and a bit spoofing Jumper and Prince Caspian ending in a great line, "it's the guy who ruined Star Wars."

So onto the acting. Spartans was a horrible movie to watch, and one of the major reasons for this was that not a single damned actor deserves to live after that movie. When Carmen Elektra comes out as the best actress in the movie you realise there is something horribly wrong. Disaster Movie to be fare works a tiny bit better because the actors don't make you want to slit your wrists repeatedly. They're by no means good, most of the main cast seemingly having wandered off the streets just to do random spoof lines. Matt Lanter, as I suppose the lead, is vaguely charismatic, although I unfortunately spent half the movie trying to figure out where I had seen him in before, he's in Heroes for those who care. He seems like he could deliver a pun if given the right material anyway. Crista Flanagan is probably the best, doing a half decent Juno impression and featuring the best scene in the movie where she gets to say overly smart things for random sake. Carman Elektra makes her rudimentary appearance, yes she still looks nice, no she still can't act, and no her brief Wanted spoof is not funny. The rest of the cast don't really matter. The woman playing the princess from Enchanted works occasionally, and then doesn't at other times.

So what is funny about the movie? Well you can count what is funny on one hand. The Alvin sketch is funny for a brief time, its way too overdone and very annoying come the end. The Juno talking bit is relatively funny. The line about Star Wars made me smirk a bit too smugly for my own good. The final song, god only knows why, was relatively smirksome, and to be honest that's really it. So what really isn't funny at all? The Michael Jackson sketch, god only knows why we're still doing Michael Jackson sketches now, any scene with a random pop celebrity, whether it be Amy Winehouse or Hannah Montana, any scene with a superhero getting hit, any scene with anybody getting hit, any scene featuring poo, any scene featuring high school musical dances. So in general the rest of the movie. Thankfully the movie is better made than the others. The score at times not being half bad, and the sets being half decent.

Anyway now to stop justifying the movies existence. Its rubbish, for the love of god do not go and watch it. I'm just being polite because its better than I expected. But do something more fun with your time, like poking yourself in the eye repeatedly.

Been coming to IMDb since, well, since it has existed. This is the first time I have felt compelled to comment on ANY movie.

The reason: The worst movie ever that had any kind of budget! I love spoof movies and will sit through a stinker if it has at least one good belly laugh.

Example: Repossessed was a dud but had one good laugh in the opening scene.

Worth the time to me.

These guys had money and talent at their disposal, and they disposed of it! I could have written a better movie.

After reading many of the comments, I thought that there was no way that they could put together a movie without at least one good laugh.

I was wrong!!! I hope the makers of this film have made their last movie. They have squandered whatever credibility they may have had.

They could have taken cuts from the movies they spoofed and added comments and it would have been better than this crap.

Pass on this movie!

Question: Why does Hollywood persist in releasing lame movies like "Disaster Movie". Answer: Because they make money.

"Disaster Movie" made it's 25 million dollar budget back in 3 weeks, on release in the States. I am assuming that it also went straight into the Top 10. From then on it was into pure profit. "Disaster Movie" will certainly make even more money overseas. On those terms alone "Disaster Movie" alone is a successful movie.

I paid money to see this dreck. (Well, kind of. I have a pass that, for a monthly fee, allows me to see unlimited movies at a particular cinema chain.) You may have paid money to see "Disaster Movie" as well, and so you should. No pirate DVD's here, thank you very much. We are responsible for potentially more rubbish like "Disaster Movie" being inflicted on the world. I apologize deeply and humbly. I hope you do to.

"Disaster Movie" is almost totally awful. (Almost totally awful? OK. I admit that for a microsecond a slight smile played across my lips at one of the "Juno" jokes, but that could just have easily been a small belch.) "Disaster Movie" is a terrible movie. A piece of cinematic poo. A textbook case of how not to make a comedy in the Noughties.

Magnificently unfunny. Obvious, witless, stupid, crass, vile and so very, very bad. Not bad in a good way. Bad in a bad way. There was definitely a whiff of death coming from that screening. People left the cinema dazed and in shock. I saw a man who looked like he had eaten his own tongue in horror at what he had just seen. When I got home after seeing "Disaster Movie", I rushed into the shower to wash off the smell. My Girlfriend noticed it. She said to me, "Have you just seen 'Disaster Movie'?"

Amazingly "Disaster Movie" is worse than "Meet The Spartans" and worse than "Superhero Movie". At least the latter had Pamela Anderson in a Fantastic Four outfit.

I would say that sometimes it is worthwhile seeing a real stinker of a movie, because that can help you appreciate the gems even more. I cannot say that seeing this movie would serve even that purpose.

If you have to see "Disaster Movie", wait for it to appear, for free, on the television. Trust me. It's not worth the effort.

review_title: Disaster Movie Sets A Title For Itself
review_detailed_main:
By my count, there are at least 25 movies referenced in "Disaster Movie," the latest abominable train wreck engineered by the untalented hacks who excreted "Date Movie," "Epic Movie," and "Meet the Spartans." Note that I do not say "Disaster Movie" spoofs or satirizes 25 movies -- only that it refers to them.

You and I know that mentioning something is not the same thing as spoofing it. (We also know that spoofing is not the same as satirizing, but that's a discussion for another day.) Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, who write and direct these films as a duo, do not know this. In their minds, all it takes to spoof "The Incredible Hulk" is for the character to show up and then be crushed by a falling cow.

Get it?! It's a character you recognize from a different movie, but here he is in THIS movie! And then he gets hurt! The title notwithstanding, disaster movies are not the object of "Disaster Movie's" satire (such as it is). You're thinking "The Towering Inferno," "The Poseidon Adventure," or "The Day After Tomorrow"; they're thinking "Sex and the City," "You Don't Mess with the Zohan," and "Juno" -- any movie that came out within the last year, in other words. The film's basic structure parallels "Cloverfield" (which sort of qualifies), and there's a reference to "Twister" -- from 12 years ago -- and the only joke is that a tornado keeps throwing cows around. But other than that, "Disaster Movie" is really nothing more than an ill-conceived, unfunny series of weak, talent-show-at-summer-camp-level skits.

Just Disastrous.

This movie is one of the worst garbage comedies of this new century. Basically Hollyweird has been cranking out this type of film since "Scary Movie" made a bundle of quick cash. But this turd is no "Scary Movie" it is only slightly better than "Meet the Spartans" which is like saying a being kicked in the face is slightly better than kneed in the groin.

Either way, it is painful to watch "Disaster Movie" since it doesn't make you laugh, jokes are driven in the ground, and the movies they spoof are not disaster movies. Most of the humor is less than juvenile, if that is possible. About the only saving grace, is the product placement was kept down to a descent level and it had good continuity. Other than that the movie isn't worth the time and money they spent making it.

Don't buy it. Don't rent it. Don't download it. You have been warned.

I guess the title already tells you everything you need to know about the movie. It is without a doubt a total disaster. I still find it quite amazing that writer directors Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer still managed to get funds to have their films made, after equally disastrous unfunny comedies such as Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans (OK, I shall unabashedly say that I enjoyed Date Movie), because while it's spoof after spoof, it certainly isn't cheap trying to replicate certain stuff, even if done laced with loads of cheese, or swede-d.

Should there be a story linking everything little crazy thing together, then it would be Cloverfield, where a group of friends Will (Matt Lanter, whose left year I found strangely out of alignment with his right?), Calvin (G. Thang), Juney (Crista Flanagan), Lisa (Kimberly Kardashian) and the Enchanted Princess (Nicole Parker) journey to save Amy (Vanessa Minnillo) before getting themselves out of the city to escape some unknown and best forgotten natural calamity, where the threat of mankind is raining cows.

The only merit I would give the filmmakers is how they went ballistic and stretched their imagination to milk every possible opportunity to script in some other movie, be it borrowing characters or premise. You'd probably lose count at the something-new-at-every-minute strategy, and frankly speaking, they're at best some skits which for the life of me, are totally unfunny. Nada, zilch, nothing to laugh about. I guess even kids will find the juvenile humour here a total turn off.

Which is not strange, considering that even jokes were borrowed, and relied too heavily on the usual toilet humour, which is already so tired. While there are comedies which can be original, the pedigree of Friedberg and Seltzer, coming as scriptwriters for Scary Movie(s), would by now reinforce that they make poor stories and jokes from their lack of innovation. Being able to string together countless of movies is one thing, but making a genuine and workable comedy is another. Not having an established cast to star in your movie might stem from a modest budget to work with, but I'm likely to think that everyone approached, save for the relative no-names here, would not want to touch this even with a ten foot pole, just in case it really stinks and stain their filmography.

I think it's even time for me to put a foot down and say No to Friedberg and Seltzer. The powers that be should really dry up the credit line that fuel their productions, and given some belt-tightening in the economy, hopefully this should be soon.

What scared me most about this film occurred to me after the opening 20 seconds.

Somewhere on this planet there is somebody who not only thinks this is funny, but that it needs to been to be shown to anybody else.

Also that there are people to fund the movie, and an audience that like it.

Thankly it seems that the only thing I have said that isn't true is the last bit, the audience hated it.

If I could score this film negative I would, avoid like a mad and rabid chipmunk!

review_title: one of the best comedies ever!
review_detailed_main: well i've just seen this movie second time and i can say that it's brilliant. in this movie you can find great songs, funny characters (especially codename - cleaner), good plot and so on... it's really worth seeing, because only in this movie you can find so many various characters, which are really similar to the real ones from the original movies (Dark Knight, Kung fu Panda, Superbad, Incredible Hulk, Hellboy, 100000 years B.C, A night in the museum, Indiana Jones, Alvin and the Chipmunks, Jumper, Hankock and others.) The person i liked the most in this movie was a silly, green princess which looked really laughable. This movie is similar to such movies as scary movie and epic movie and it's probably could be in top 10 comedies ever

I cant describe how awful this movie was. Some people say this movie is great (and thats OK since we all have different views) but frankly i don't give a damn. this movie was so terrible its freaking hilarious yes i know they made fun of maybe great movies but who the hell likes listening to a girl burp for 5 minutes?? And you would think they didn't have to use "each" joke for to long but then you're wrong. Because they manage to take a joke (everyone of them) which is not funny in the beginning and wear it up so that you only want to end your life there and then just to make it stop. If you're ever going to see this movie Don't!

review_title: this is the worst movie i've ever seen.
review_detailed_main:
and i'm not exaggerating. there is no plot whatsoever all it is is a bunch of stupid parodies on pop culture that aren't even funny. the only people laughing in the theater when i saw it were kids that were 13 and under.

please, i'm begging you, jason friedberg and aaron seltzer. if you read this, get it through your heads that the steamy piles of crap that you keep producing are not funny.

stop making movies, buy a house with the money you've made, and never come out again.

everything you guys make is garbage.

review_title: ...and the award for Worst Movie Ever goes to...
review_detailed_main:
THIS SCORE IS ACTUALLY A MINUS 1 OUT OF 10 BUT THE LOWEST SCORE I CAN GO TO ON IMDb IS A 1! Over the course of one evening, an unsuspecting group of twenty-somethings find themselves bombarded by a series of natural disasters and catastrophic events.

Yes, yet again, the famous duo who has wrecked a whole genre between the pair of them return for their latest movie, Disaster Movie. There is literally nothing here to review. The story doesn't exist, there is literally no story at all, it's nowhere to be seen. The characters were yet again stupid for humour and yet again they failed to make anyone laugh. The writers have written nothing but an unfunny sketch show that lasts for a dire hour and a half. The jokes and 'funny' scenes weren't anywhere near funny. The acting was awful and the characters were just pop and movie references and wasn't shy about it either. The only character that almost got a smile from me was Juno or "Juney" as she is called in this atrocious movie. Basically, I'm just repeating what I've said for the other three movies they've made.

Disaster Movie is without a doubt the worst movie I have ever seen. I felt like I was having my eyes poked repetitively while being set on fire and that was only in the first five minutes. Friedburg and Seltzer have no clue how to write anything or how to make any kind of movie. I think they have a contest between themselves to see whether they can make a movie crappier than the last, I think this time they've really done it because it officially can't get any worse.

Read more reviews at: www.dudedazzmoviereviews.wordpress.com

I'm honestly not quite sure on what I should say...

There were a few cheap laughs...

No plot whatsoever...

Moments of pure stupidity and disgust...

Worst $9 I've spent in a long time...

How the hell keeps releasing these movies? Why the hell do I keep watching them? They should have left the movie parody movies to the Wayans brothers.

Could that be all there is to be said? No, I have one more thing to say about 2008's Disaster Movie... It was just plain awful.

review_title: I walked out after 10 minutes, and damn happy I did!!!!
Well, they got the title right...
review_detailed_main:
I must say that this is, without a doubt, one of the worst (if not THE worst) films I have seen. The humor is uninspired and repeated way too often. The production values are way too low, the cast, to put it lightly sucks. And they just reference movies instead of actually parodying them.

In fact, the only redeeming quality in the entire film is the Chipmunk scene. But even that couldn't save this bullsh*t excuse of a film. So all and all, I have to make this ten lines (Stupid rules). And I have to do so by adding things to this review that does not (and will not) make any sense to the general thing.

review_title: I think the review guidelines need to be changed here
review_detailed_main:
I'm sitting here reading these posted reviews for this movie and thinking to myself either all these reviewers are over 80 years old or they are wound so tight they squeak when they walk....or both. The movie is FUN...it's STUPID COMEDY...just because every movie isn't Ben Hur or The Godfather doesn't make it total junk. If someone is going to read the reviews of this movie, then odds are they know what this movie is about. And they don't need to hear what a bunch of square eggs say about it, either. It would be tantamount to asking a bunch of 18-year-olds writing a review on the silent film "The Birth of a Nation". In my opinion, any review giving a movie less than 5 stars must've been written by someone not appreciating what the movie is all about (and should be discarded). In other words, people who shouldn't have watched the movie in the first place. Maybe every movie theater should ALWAYS have Driving Miss Daisy available to these people just in case they may be "forced" to watch something different. That being said, I loved Date Movie, Superhero Movie, and a whole list of other stupid comedy movies and I don't think this movie was that bad...though not that great, either. If you liked Meet the Spartans, you'll like this one. It is pretty fast-paced and there are some funny parts you'll remember. I really would give this movie a 6 or 7, but I'm upping it to an 8 because I don't think a 1.3 rating is fair AT ALL.

Hope this helps someone.

review_title: Yes, it really was a disaster
review_detailed_main:
But we all knew that just from seeing the trailer, right? Or, at least, *some* of us did. According to my friend, the trailer was "piss-your-pants hilarious!" He's the reason I went to see this. No one else would be stupid enough to go with him and I didn't want him to go by himself because I expected the cinema to be empty. It pretty much was. The only other people there was a family of about 5 (who, I might add, walked out not even halfway through) and a couple of teenagers who somehow managed to survive it all. I salute their bravery.

I think this may be the first time I saw a "comedy" (and I use that term very lightly) in a cinema and no one laughed. Not a single giggle. Not even from the teenagers, who were surprisingly quiet. As for me, I just sat there completely stone-faced asking myself why I had used my free cinema pass on this. The answer? Because 1) there was no way in hell that I was paying £7.50 on this (pardon the pun) disaster and 2) because I didn't want, nay, couldn't let my friend face this alone. And what was the result? 90 minutes of the lamest jokes ever made. I don't think even my friend liked it, which was quite the surprise since he loved Date Movie, Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans. Now, exactly what does that tell you? Besides the fact that my friend likes stupid comedies, of course.

Chances are, you have no intentions of seeing this. Good, because this movie is low even for spoof standards. If you go see it at the cinema, you waste your time and money. If you watch it for free online, you waste your time. Basically, you waste something valuable if you watch this movie. IQ points, for example. Much like the producers of this movie.

Oh dear. I honestly don't know what compelled me to see this film (not in the cinema, thank GOD) - possibly the fact that I have seen previous "Movie Movies" and I knew just what to expect.

Oh and they didn't disappoint.

Firstly, the "jokes" were utterly abysmal - I didn't laugh once during the course of this film, and seriously regretted even watching it. Second, how much did it actually cost to make this film? Because seriously, the effects were awful. Clearly they either cheaped out on everything, or had no money to begin with.

The only thing good about this film is the fact that it's unsurprisingly short, so you have enough time to beat your head into a wall repeatedly after having watched it.

DO NOT WATCH THIS FILM.

review_title: It's not a disaster in all markets...
review_detailed_main: To answer another contributor's comment, they make this kind of garbage because it sells in some markets. Here in the Middle East, movies that are: over the top, brutal, have toilet/silly humor, or have a scene that gets by the censors results in box office lineups. Movies appeal differently to each overseas market, but violent, risqué, or nonsense humor does well in many of them. Movies that come in between 8 and 9 on the IMDb scale usually don't do well here. They are perceived as too subtle (boring), are character driven (characters don't tear up the screen), have a message to tell (don't lecture me) or have a strong cultural theme (REAL American life is not interesting), don't do well. Blockbusters with mega stars do well everywhere. But movies like Disaster movie go straight to DVD and overseas markets. Shameful but true.

Some twenty something man named Will (Matt Latner) had an unusual dream where he was in the movie "10000 B.C" as Amy Whitehouse warns him that the end of the world is gonna happen. However it has became reality as disasters are occurring in the city as friends like Calvin (G. Thang Johnson), Amy (Vanessa Minnolo) and Enchanted Princess (Nicole Parker) all join forces to battle against ravenous singing chipmunks, fight Beowulf and Kung Fu Panda, deal with superheros and even return the Crystal Skull back to save the world.

An unbelievable mess of a movie! Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer who gave us the awful parody movies "Date Movie", "Epic Movie" and "Meet The Spartans" have finally done a movie worse then any of them. Despite having the talented Kim Kardashian, Carmen Elektra and Tony Cox the movie is just one hopeless movie. Despite it's title, it only spoofs a few actual disaster movies like "Armageddon", "Cloverfield" and "Twist" but spoofs non-disaster movies like "High School Musical", "Beowulf", "Kung Fu Panda", "Wanted", "Iron Man", "Dark Knight", "Incredible Hulk" etc. and other movies that were released recently and the year after. They just reference stuff without trying to spoof them and throw pop culture references into the jokes without being funny, tasteless vulgar jokes that are very forehead slapping and groan inducing and beyond awful acting.

This movie looks like it was filmed in a cardboard box, it's that bad! avoid this crap at all cost.

Why bother making this crap? After seeing the many horrendous spoofs out there, (Date Movie, Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans, etc) I felt that those would be the standard for the rating of 1 (awful).

This movie was not only worse than the others, but it really takes the word "awful" down a further notch.

A spoof is defined as a light and humorous parody. There definitely was parody in this movie. It makes fun of so many films, high school musical, jumper, iron man, hitch... just to name a few. However, nothing was light or humorous about this film. All the jokes were amazingly overkilled. The first time was not even funny and the second time around just irritates the hell out of you.

Needless to say there is absolutely no plot or even remotely like one. All other spoofs make a feeble attempt at one. This one either ran out of budget or time and just threw crap together and called it a spoof, or it just doesn't know the meaning of it.

So... should I recommend this film?

review_title: The parody gods are punishing me...
Well, It Lives Up To The Title
review_detailed_main:
I RARELY can't get through a movie and that includes "Manos". But this: This is awful.

If the point was to make a movie that was about disasters and, ITSELF, was a disaster, then mission accomplished. Somehow I don't think that was the point.

Look, don't do mushrooms and coke and then try to write a screenplay, ok? The jokes weren't even really jokes unless they were trying to Lampoon themselves. The characters weren't likable. I've seen better scripts from Z Movies shot in a basement with a 99$ Vivitar purchased at Walmart.

Seltzer needs to stop. These movies just get worse and worse.

This movie is the worst ever! It is a disgrace that someone actually made it and even worse someone agreed to distribute it. The jokes are pathetic (if you can call them jokes) there is absolutely no story line. Not that you expect a story line for a spoof, but at least there should be a logical sequence of events. Not even the semi-hot girl is enough to warrant a 5 second view of the flick. The poor actors will most likely never find a job again. Carmen Electra is in the movie, she looks old and did a very bad job. If you want to see a good spoof movie, rent Top Secret or Airplane. Even the last pathetic Scary Movie is much better than this. I cannot really indicate to anybody how much this movie sucks.
What a masterpiece. One of the greatest movies ever.

review_title: It is good if you want to torture someone
review_detailed_main:
Tie someone in a chair,put this movie at TV, and force that person to watch.

When that person is watching it, he/she will probably have a cerebral hemorrhage,or will have an epilepsy at how bad this movie is.

Works 100%. Trust me.

Not a movie to consider watching with any group of people. Even if you have seen the movies this film makes parodies of, the humor falls dreadfully short of anything that would make you laugh. The lack of an interesting plot is replaced with weak and clichéd one-liners that make this movie a chore to sit through. You will find yourself thinking - "How much longer does this movie have? Where is my order from Amazon? Did I have an appointment today?" and you quickly occupy yourself doing other, much more interesting activities such as writing reviews on IMDb while the movie fills the background with useless noise. How on earth a producer was willing to fund this movie will make one wonder how such good movies can come out of Hollywood with "wet rags" such as Disaster Movie receiving such publicity before a short and stunted appearance in movie theaters Then again if you have ABSOLUTELY NOTHING better to do with an hour and a half of your life, look no further. I would recommend folding laundry instead. While the appearances of familiar faces from other similar comedies such as Epic Movie will create an atmosphere of familiarity, you not feel at all as though you were part of the action, and be fully aware that you are wasting time sitting on your couch watching the worst movie (with little doubt) of 2008.

dude, i completely agree with the first comment there, these movies were OK when they were done by the Wayans bros. Now it is just a pile of garbage, i'm glad i didn't have to pay to watch that but it sucked b/c i wasted a few hours of sleep, which would have been way more productive than the one spending in front of the TV trying to count how many times i tried not to laugh on purpose in awe of how bad this flick was. Like the first guy said, it is not a parody at all, it's a bunch of one liners of many different movies that put together made Disaster Movie. Horrible, and the thing that i don't get is how could they come up with stuff like that every 2 months. Whoever hires these screenwriters/directors/whatever should be the ones to blame, and the actors, please!

I want to see a really good parody movie. One that's dumb and crass and non-intellectual.

But although this movie is all those things it's not good. It spends way too much time on one joke and many scenes feel like they take forever. I feel I could have written some scenes better or come up with better gags after seeing the scenario.

I can imagine a lot of movies I like less but it's not worth the time. Maybe watch it for a quick distraction in the hotel room but it really doesn't deserve the attention.

Edit: I am a bit surprised it is the lowest rated movie on this whole site. Sure it kind of sucks but I would never say it was ever a candidate for worst movie ever. I would say there are many movies much worse than this. I would take this over the following:

Mother!

This is Spinal Tap

Schindler's List

The Conjuring

Apartment 1303

Bridesmaids
I challenge you to find a worse movie. If there were a negative ranking system, this movie would whole heartedly deserve it.

review_title: I can be very relaxed with comedy, this movie made me want to rage.
review_detailed_main: Even after multiple beers I was beyond annoyed. Not one joke lands. I grew up and was a teen when this movie and all the movies they are mocking came out. It's not funny. I like bad movies some times. As a laugh or escape. I wish this move was like " the room", but it genuinely has nothing to quote or like or poke fun of. Seriously, it's like a 3rd grader wrote a summary of trailers of movies that he watched a week ago. Painful.
