review_detailed_main: its awful movie not funny at all.i thought its going to be hilarious movie.but no no no its nothing like that,bad story bad actors it was so boring that I've had to sleep every 10 minutes.so i highly recommend not lose your time on this.the real deal for me is scary movie4 that was a movie that you cant pretend that isn't funny.I don't know what they were thinking when they made this movie ,high school musical 3 or wanted and a lot more movies that didn't released in theaters was included in very bad and awful jokes and scenes. so just wait and see how scary movie 5 i hope it will be funny or great movie as we all want.

review_title: Oh my frigging god, this movie was hysterical, have a frigging sense of humor!!
review_detailed_main: I watched this movie with my friends and i loved it. It was a riot! You must have a sense of humor to have fun with a movie like this. People that think these movies are stupid suck, because people say that imitation is the greatest form of flattery. So i just want to say screw all the people that hated this movie! Nicole Parker is hilarious as the Princess, and Crista Flanagan did amazing too, i wish to be as funny as them one day. Best out of all the spoof movies. Hopefully more to come! I loved all the awesome humor with the celebrity look-a likes, and the song at the end was awesome. For all people that hate HSM (High School Musical) must watch this! Really good fun movie.

review_title: Friedberg and Seltzer blur the boundaries of the imagination in genius form
review_detailed_main:
Ever heard the phrase, "there's a fine line between genius and madness"? Well never before have these words rung more true than in this comedic masterpiece from the ultimate players of the genre - Friedberg and Seltzer.

Having already produced such classics as Epic Movie and Date Movie, one could be forgiven for assuming that there is no way the masters of timing and perception could once again achieve the dizzy heights of their previous work...but they've done it.

Whilst most comedies rely on appalling flatulence jokes and knockabout slapstick, this new work brings together chance encounter, Shakespearean circumstance, and hilarious consequences worthy of the works of Marlow or Goldsmith. The script is biting - crisp and fresh - full of ideas executed to perfection by the stellar cast.

Another point to be noted and hailed, is the use of props and costume. Never before have such realistic caricatures been so well created - a mix of great costume design and wonderful acting.

In making Disaster Movie, Friedberg and Seltzer have redefined the boundaries of hilarious comedy, setting the bar so high, that no comedy produced in the next ten years could possibly match it. This wonder of cinema is a masterpiece, and guarantees a feature length thrill ride of jaw-dropping action, masterful pathos and bathos, and possibly the most iconic comedy script of the last fifty years.

...or it's the worst thing ever made, including the H-bomb, and you must never see this yawning dog turd ever.
The title says it all, it's a DISASTER MOVIE😂 Just one of those cash-in movies that would mash up all Pop Culture references, bad acting and lame jokes.
Holy moly this movie... I got the stomach flu after watching this, and I don't think it was a coincidence. Please... I beg you please... Don't watch this movie.

review_title: Yes, it's as bad as everyone is saying
review_detailed_main:
Lots of crude jokes...but are their any smart ones, like in Scary Movie? Let's see, hmmm...no! There is no jokes that aren't crude. You can take a look in the quotes section if you don't believe me. In fact, I think it's stupid for me to write a review for this bullcrap. I'm just in so much anger watching it, that I had to release my anger by writing this down. You won't laugh once. There was also this pointless cheerleader scene which was utterly stupid, and unintelligent. I felt like killing myself when I reached the end of the movie. My eyeballs were melting...you're TEARING ME APART, Disaster Movie!

However, I guess the batman homage scene was relatively funny. But trust me, there will be no other jokes that'll make you laugh.

Overall, I give this a very generous 1.4/10. Holy crap, that movie was bad.

review_title: whoever financed production of this movie, has too much money
review_detailed_main:
I've seen thousands of movies. I respect opinions of people who liked this one, but for me it the worst movie ever; personally I probably needed to be 12 or 15 years old to have a more positive opinion of it. It's like "Scary Movie" knock-off with jokes so weak, it would take a very special talent with a single digit IQ to present its "genius" to the world. I'd rather watch political news for the last few months than see this movie once. Damn, i'd rather watch blank white screen for 2 hours than this piece of what doesn't even qualify as "kitsch" and have more fun. I can think of only one scene that could have been real fun. The one with the "No Country For Old Man" iconic guy with a tank in his hand, coming up to the movie director making a cameo in the movie, and sticking that gas valve to his forehead, and pulling the trigger. That scene would have made the production #1 of the worst movies ever, as it still (mysteriously) has trouble getting to that spot.

Seriously, I'm writing down names of the directors, and swearing to avoid any of their future productions. I don't think they should be allowed near screenwriters or video cameras anymore, warranted by a court-issued restraining order.

review_title: How NOT to Make a Spoof & a Comedy In General

review_detailed_main: This film isn't funny, even the ironic title is not funny. It's so bad, even the name of this review is not funny. Such a bad film deserves a badly constructed review. This seems to be a spoof of bad films. But films like Hancock, Batman, etc etc are not bad so therefore it's a spoof of its own. Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, you two are idiots. The jokes are not clever. The plot is rubbish. Stringing together characters of other films from 2007-2008 is possibly the worst idea I have ever seen. Some of the scenes are a shameless-no shameful copy of the films that they supposed to parody. Parody? This is too ironic- like my review.

review_title: Should be renamed "Disaster of a movie"
review_detailed_main:
I have nothing against a good spoof movie. A number of good spoof movies have come and gone, such as Mystery Men which i thoroughly enjoyed.

For a spoof movie to work, it has to be funny. But the comedy here in "Disaster movie" is horrible. Disaster movie is obviously a spoof of all those big budget blockbuster films and other movies that were released in the same year. However The entire thing plays out like a lazy boy's fan-fiction gone wrong.

It is a mish mash of some of the corniest dialog and most slip shod narrative in the history of even Spoof movies.

More stupid than funny, more idiotic than witty, "Disaster movie" is a flop on so many levels.

In fact, I'm so cheesed off at wasting 88 minutes of my life watching this crap (I would be a lot more sore if i had actually PAID to watch this) that I'm going to end this review right here.

I saw this movie with four friends, and we were all laughing our heads off from beginning to end! I don't care if the movie doesn't have realistic acting, I don't care if the plot isn't meaningful; it's not meant to be! People, please judge a movie by what it's meant for! What I loved about this movie was that it included the characters from many classic cartoons in the most bizarre ways possible! Seeing Alvin and the chipmunks going mad, Kung Fu Panda coming out of no where to fight, Batman being humiliated, and the whole nonsense of this movie made me enjoy my time and go to bed with a smile on my face. I've also seen Superhero Movie, Epic movie, and a few others in this gender, though this was the first one I saw, and the most I enjoyed. I give it a 10, but only for THIS gender. This doesn't mean I enjoyed this movie more than I did, say, "Inglorious Basterds", which I gave a 9; I'm simply judging the movie by what it's meant to be and in it's own gender.

review_title: It's Called Disaster Movie For A Reason
review_detailed_main:
WARINING MAY CONTAIN SPOILER!

I have seen a LOT of bad movies in my life but this is one of the worst. I honestly hoped it would be good. I'm a big fan of spoof movies and watching the preview, I thought it could be the next Epic Movie, but boy was I wrong. It actually had a lot of potential but they didn't even utilize the jokes they could have used. They didn't even TRY to make this funny, THEY DIDN'T EVEN TRY! The jokes seemed like they were written by a nine-year old with Tourettes Syndrome! There was not one thing funny about this movie, in fact it doesn't even qualify as a movie! This crap makes "Meet The Spartans" look good! "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 3" was better than this and thats saying a lot! If you see this "movie" sitting on the shelf of a store, walk away from it and never look back!

review_title: Acting and script are horrible, but that's the point. So don't take it seriously
review_detailed_main:
Horrible movie, but it's suppose to be that way. It had so many cringe and hard to watch scenes, but that was the whole point of the movie. So for that, I give it a five.

The writing was also very weird, but that made it kinda funny. You should definitely not take this movie seriously. It's just a dumb parody like any other, but with some funny jokes towards famous celebrities.

I don't think this movie should have the lowest rating on IMDb, because it succeeded in being a "disaster movie".

This movie is for example way better than the movie "the room" by Tommy Wiseau. THAT IS THE WORST MOVIE BY FAR!

I watched this movie a few years ago, what I was not expecting was a movie that was full of horrible jokes aswell as acting and CGI that belonged to a school project, I know its supposed to be a comedy movie, but this is not even funny, stay away and dont even try to give it a go.

review_title: It really is a disaster, like a pile of poop lmao!
review_detailed_main: Only saw this once or twice - I don't remember - many years ago; haven't been interested in seeing it again since there was a time when I was younger and I slightly enjoyed dumb movies but this went to deep into stupidity. That's about it - nothing good about it just a drag!

review_title: The name says it all... Really, not joking...
Worst movie I have ever seen. 0/10 if possible.
review_detailed_main: I'm not excusing this because it is a parody, this is the worst Motion Picture I have ever seen, by the time I had finished this movie, I had vomited almost 10 times, and I cried in a corner, questioning humanity, NEVER watch this.

review_title: Worst Movie I Have Ever Seen
review_detailed_main:
Reviewed on April 9, 2011

Disaster Movie has got to be the worst movie that I have ever seen in my entire life. Whoever thinks this was a great movie was probably blind because this movie was a total disaster. There is a lot of.gross-out jokes and toilet humor in this movie, and they ruin a lot of good movies (including my favorite movie of all time The Dark Knight, which is a FAR superior movie than this crap), the acting is so awful, every single character is unlikable, the plot is unoriginal, the story is horrible, the Alvin and the Chipmunks parody is horrendous, the music is abysmal, and the special effects are poor.

Disaster Movie is the worst movie I have ever seen.

It's worse than...

The Last Airbender Dragonball Evolution Battlefield Earth Ratatoing The Little Panda Fighter The Little Cars in the Great Race What's Up: Balloon to the Rescue!

Son of the Mask Catwoman Home Alone 4: Taking Back the House Space Chimps 1 & 2 Doogal Bratz (2007) Mean Girls 2 Batman and Robin Mortal Kombat: Annihilation Fred: The Movie The Secret of NIMH 2: Timmy to the Rescue Speed 2: Cruise Control Super Mario Bros. (1993) The Hunchback of Notre Dame II Superman: The Quest for Peace The Next Karate Kid Happily N'Ever After The Wild A Troll in Central Park Re-Animated Barney's Great Adventure Belle's Magical World Alpha and Omega The Cat in the Hat (2003) Yogi Bear (2010) Open Season 3 Grease 2 The Santa Clause 3: The Escape Clause Gulliver's Travels (2010) Pearl Harbor and of course EPIC MOVIE!

This NEVER gets a recommendation from me. It's absolutely abysmal. I'd recommend better movies than this like The Dark Knight, The Lord of the Rings trilogy, the original Star Wars trilogy, Beauty and the Beast, The Godfather, Terminator 2: Judgement Day, The Lion King, The Matrix, The Shawshank Redemption, Spirited Away, and many other movies that are far superior than this crap.

Rating: 1/10.

review_detailed_main: This movie sucks big time, Dave your money also avoid vampire sucks, epic movie and meet the Spartans I'm sure they're all made by this same dumb team.

review_title: 10 minutes of this film is more than enough
review_detailed_main: Sometimes a film can be so bad it's funny. Rest assured this isn't one of those times.

review_title: Plot twist: the director didn't care about success, but wanted to end the careers all actors involved
review_detailed_main: There are so many good actors, especially from MadTV, in the movie and it still sucks. It's clear the director and other off screen people wanted to ruin these actors' careers.

review_title: One of the worst movies ever made by far.

review_detailed_main:
I have seem most of these Friedberg/Seltzer films, despite knowing full well how bad they would be. What can I say? They fascinate me. Pretty much everyone intelligent enough to have an IMDb account knows why they're bad if they've ever seen any of the trailers. DISATSER MOVIE is, like all of them, useless. I didn't laugh. But it's still noticeably better than MEET THE SPARTANS. Despite the horrible costumes and puppets, it's not as horribly cheap looking and flimsy. It does have an embarrassingly empty "comic dance off sequence", but at least unlike SPARTANS it doesn't take up about 25% of the screen time. The JUNO spoof has a little bite to it, and Crista Flanagan's impression is pretty good. Nicole Parker brings some energy to the ENCHANTED spoof. It's not quite as jaw-dropping in its condescension to the audience as SPARTANS, which had the genuinely unbelievable moment where Friedberg and Seltzer thought they needed a narrator to explain that a scene where Carmen Electra wore a SPIDER-MAN suit was a SPIDER-MAN parody. Where SPARTANS had several gross-out gags that were too nauseating to be even vaguely amusing, DISASTER MOVIE has only one.

Is it really worth noting that DISASTER MOVIE is an improvement when it's still painfully unfunny? Well if you had a student who failed all his classes and was also excessively disruptive, and he went to merely failing his classes, you'd have to say one or two nice things on parent's night.

The best thing you can say about DISASTER MOVIE is that it's exhaustive check-list "parodying" of almost every major summer 2008 release might make it a somewhat effective nostalgia trip in another decade or so.

review_title: The title says what it is
review_detailed_main: This movie is called Disaster movie, and that's exactly what it is! A disaster movie!!! Everything about this movie is awful, the acting, the plot and everything else!!! No wonder everyone hates this movie and doesn't talk about it, because it's one of the worst movies of 2007!!! I totally think you should stay away from this *Disaster movie*

review_detailed_main: This has GYATT to be one of the best films I ever seen. By the first 5 minutes I was like what the skibidi "I have never seen more ohio sigma characters." This film was lowkey cooking. The jokes hit, actors performed perfectly and it had a 69420 aura. I have already spent over $50 on purchasing the 4k blu-ray edition on purchasing it on apple tv because why the heck not. This film honestly had some good ohio rizz but could have included skibidi toilet references and the charactes should be more like rizzlers. This is an honest review and I highly suggest you watch it with your friends, family and at school.

review_title: This films ruined the parody genre
review_detailed_main: Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer single handily killed the parody comedy genre. A genre that has created great films like Spaceballs and Scary Movie. This film decides to take a bold strategy, in that it decided to never not once be even a little bit funny. Lazy, superficially and utterly forgettable. Seldom has a pic been more appropriately titled than Disaster Movie, yet another frantically unfunny free-form farce. The fun fact is that the real disaster movies have more laughs than this spoof. This movie begs the question why would you watch a bad movie about better movies, when you could just rent the originals instead? This film is the least unfunny movie of all time.
The name of the movie has never been more accurate.

It's easy to see why this film is the worst rated film in IMDB history and has been since its release. It's dreadful. However in a strange sort of way I found it surprisingly enjoyable, I actually found Epic Movie to be a fair bit worse. It's rather endearing to me watching terrible films, this was an intriguing experience.

So bad it's good? Well, kind of, but maybe not for the right reasons. More like so atrocious it becomes entertaining because of that.

The acting is poor no bones about it, it does seem that they're trying to be over the top but it doesn't even come off that way. Date Movie had a poor script like this one but some decent acting, resulting in a far better film. The film does not parody disaster movies and their tropes, it almost exclusively parodies popular releases at the time such as Juno (the actor playing 'Juney' actually did an okay job at imitating Juno.) The only thing resembling a disaster movie was the fact that sometimes the camera shakes around uncontrollably which is mean to resemble an earthquake. Well, it doesn't.

It has pretty much no story, it's just a case of the directors trying to cram in as many pop culture references as possible in the same film. Basically, a young man is told by an Amy Winehouse impersonator that an earthquake's gonna happen and they're all gonna die!

Then that's it as far as the story goes. He also has a girlfriend who he finds in bed with Flava Flav (how was he relevant in 2008?) at the start of the film. He goes back to try and save her and succeeds. It's hardly a beautiful, tear-inducing romance, it's fair to say.

If breaking the world record on most amount of pop culture references in one film was what they were trying to achieve then they did it because this film has an outrageous amount of them and is almost the movie's only form of humour, alongside fart jokes. I confess I laughed maybe a surprising amount of times throughout, hence the 3 stars. However, most of these laughs were not because of the quality of the jokes, but more their complete lack of quality. How did this get greenlit? I guess that's why it's so interesting. The enchanted princess was quite funny with some her lines though. The things that do resemble jokes usually go on for so long that they just aren't even jokes anymore.

The song at the end was actually quite catchy and memorable. The special effects are just horrible, did this really have a 20 million dollar budget? Costumes look alright though.

Horrendous film but I found it fun to watch because of that. Not because of it being good or even watchable. Maybe if you watched it with a few buddies drunk at a party you could have some fun. Or not. Yeah, probably not.

This is the only film i've seen that i'd give 0/10 to, if i could.

Now I'm not a fan of the filmmakers and their last effort, MEET THE SPARTANS, was horrendously unfunny. So I was dreading DISASTER MOVIE but am surprised to admit that it actually had some solid laughs. The film is essentially a free form blender of pop culture references in scene after scene with a threadbare plot to connect them. However, the interesting thing about the satire here is how dark and cynical it is. The film rightly points out the cynicism and hypocrisy of teen entertainment (ex. the shallow consumerism and robotic nature of HANNAH MONTANA, the mindless songs and false chasteness of HIGH SCHOOL MUSICAL, the overwritten, annoying banter of JUNO, et al.). Even family films are deservedly skewered (the heroine of ENCHANTED turned into a drugged out, homeless hooker, KUNG FU PANDA literally a guy in a costume brawling it out and best of all, the savage ALVIN & THE CHIPMUNKS sequence that turns them into CRITTERS style, metal loving evil puppets). And how true it is that the summer blockbusters consist of one comic book film after another being churned into the marketplace for our consumption (the film correctly portrays the "superheroes" in this fashion, with a cow splattering each of them one by one). Add to that a musical number that ties all of these references together in a seamless fashion. Friedberg and Seltzer still have an amateurish quality to their film-making and several sequences are allowed to drag on a bit to kill time. But overall this is definitely worth a look and maybe you'll be surprised.
Atrocious writing, directing, characters, acting, jokes and every single moment of this film.

10,000 B.C., Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull, No Country for Old Men, Wanted, Juno, Harold and Kumar, Hancock, The Day After Tomorrow, Jumper, Narnia Prince Caspian, Enchanted, Step Up 1 & 2, Iron Man, Hell Boy, Hulk, Get Smart (dog poop on the phone shoe. What a classic. LOL.), Batman, Speed Racer, Beowulf, Kung Fu Panda, "Me, Myself, and Irene"

The dance and fight choreography where impressive, and the special effects weren't bad. Good production value.

Debut for some talent, too. I did not recognize the same actor in so many parts.

There where also some things that I just didn't understand at all, but they made me laugh anyway, for some reason.... Like the black dance double. What's that about? LMAO?!

Sure, I'll play along with the low rating gag. Wouldn't want to ruin it. I didn't know it was just a joke. I guess I'll see "Epic Movie", now.
Even as a spoof, even as a bad spoof this scrapes the bottom. Teeth grindingly tedious - flat one liners- a mush mash of familiar movies - it's just so bad.

review_title: The Zucker / Abrahams films were, at least some time, really funny. But that's it?
review_detailed_main: He's beginning to look less and less like a satire, or something with his own real comic identity, and more and more like a straightforward humorless knockoff, a generic can of "own brand" grocery beans. It is like a Fine Fare Cola celluloid bottle. Disaster Movie, like everyone else, provides a low-rent reminder of successful box office films and popular American TV.And, well, it's fairly much that. It's not limited to disaster movies as such (which wouldn't matter if it's funny), but the audience is obviously expected to point and laugh at just recognizing, say, Wolf from American Gladiators, or at least the actor got up to look like him.All too often there is no real joke in attendance, although I admit that Crista Flanagan provides the pregnant Ellen Page in Juno a shrewd impression.Of course, most British viewers will not recognize solely American television references, and we, the culturally oppressed, may incidentally resent an American actor pretending to be Amy Winehouse with a limey-speaking accent on "drinking petrol." What to drink? The Zucker / Abrahams films were, at least some time, really funny. But that's it?

It is more painful then having a door wrapped in barbwire shoved up your butt sideways. Childbirth is but pleasant compared the agonizing, torturous, and cringe-inducing 87-minute experience you go through when watch this. The pain is much more extreme than that of when you chug a ton of hot sauce and then have to go to the bathroom later that day, only to find out that you are releasing scorching hot diarrhea out of your anus, which feels no better than pure lava. It is not any better than stepping on a Lego ten times in a row, or being flayed alive, or being tormented by having boiling oil poured all over your skin. Do you understand what I am saying? What you undergo when watching this movie is not pleasant!

This doesn't even qualify for 'so bad it's good'. This was torture. I didn't even crack a smile once. Not even the Matt Damon jokes were funny! How? How could you make a Matt Damon joke not funny?

There are numerous bad movies out there, such as 'Meet the Spartans', 'Epic Movie', and 'Date Movie', but this!? This!? Why was this released? None of the jokes are funny, the acting is garbage, the dialogue is horrendous, and the humor is unnecessarily crude and stupid. After watching this, I couldn't stop vomiting. It's that bad.

Juney, who is supposed to be this quirky pregnant teen, talks like an idiot. She is supposed to exaggerate the style of speech which is common among Gen-Z's, but it's not funny and it's stupid as heck. It's. Not. Funny. At. All.

Do yourself a favor: Do not watch this. Watch something good, like Vertigo, Casablanca, The Godfather, Citizen Kane, or if you would prefer a comedy movie, then you should watch something like 'Some Like It Hot', 'Arsenic and Old Lace', or Doctor Strangelove: Or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb'. Those are some good comedy movies. Not this trash. If you want a good reason to stab yourself in the eye with a fork, then watch this. Otherwise, don't.
The movie is the disaster as is American baseless culture. dumb, not funny
This movie is campy and fun. I was shocked to see a 1.9 rating. It's not meant to be an Emmy winner; you guys clearly don't get it. (facepalm)

review_title: Words can't describe how bad this POS of a film is.

review_detailed_main:
The storyline in "Disaster Movie" is a pretty archetypical spoof movie. So if you enjoyed movies such as "Scary Movie", "Epic Movie", "Not Another Teen Movie", etc., then you know what you are in for here as well, and I guess you will enjoy "Disaster Movie as well.

Writers and directors Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer put together a fair enough script and storyline for "Disaster Movie". I was adequately entertained, though it wasn't exactly a particularly outstanding comedy experience.

The acting performances in "Disaster Movie" were fairly adequate, and there were a couple of familiar faces on the cast list, with the likes of Tony Cox, Tad Hilgenbrink, Carmen Electra and Kim Kardashian.

Watchable for what it was, "Disaster Movie" is a kind of spoof that you watch once, then hardly return to it a second time, as there just wasn't sufficient contents to the storyline to support more than a single viewing.

My rating of "Disaster Movie" lands on a five out of ten stars.

review_title: One of the worst movies ever -an embarrassment to humans ,what the heck is this awful crap?.....

review_detailed_main:
Nothing in Disaster Movie works. The actors don't even try, the jokes are the worst I have ever heard, the effects are painful to watch, the parodies are horrible, everything fails. The jokes are extremely unfunny, random at times, often don't feel like they have punch lines, and they go forever. In a film that is less than an hour and a half the jokes should not all be a minute long. When a joke is told the film feels like you just hit pause. The film stops, tells the very long and terrible joke, and when it is over and the film moves on it just stops again for another bad joke just seconds later. The parodies are unfunny, random at times, and make me feel horrible. All the jokes in the film are either physical (unfunny) or parody (very unfunny). A parody is meant to make someone laugh about something they've seen. This makes parodies the wrong way. Instead of making fun and at the same time honoring the thing being parodied Disaster Movie does neither of those two things. It doesn't honor anything. It doesn't make fun of much. The parodies are just there. The parodies most of the time are just the character from another movie saying that they are that character and then the character gets hurt. This is due to the parodies being made from trailers of the movies. Friedberg and Seltzer give a bad name to parodies when there is a lot of good parodies. Now to due this and other films under the same two directors the parody genre should retire. In the end Disaster Movie is a true disaster.

0 stars out of 4

Also an MJ molesting joke in 2008. At the time MJ jokes hadn't been considered funny for years. The was just failure to realize a change in humor.

review_title: The Best Worst Movie of the Year
review_detailed_main:
Nicole Parker knocks it out of the park in this movie. She's the #1 reason you have to see this flick. The theater was laughing out loud at her antics as the Enchanted Princess. Her Amy Winehouse spoof is hilarious, and done perfectly.

Next best would be Crista Flanagan who cleans up with her Juno spoofs. I didn't care for the script writing in terms of the way she exits the movie (no spoiler here). Likewise, the writers could have given her more to work with in her Hannah Montana bit.

Ike Barinholtz as Beowolf is not to be missed. I never new this guy had such talent until seeing him play about a dozen side-splitting characters in this film.

Vanessa Mannillo and Matt Lanter are such great eye candy for you and your girlfriend to watch during any lulls in the movie that you can't give this less than 8 stars out of 10. A hilarious no-brainer comedy that's just what the doctor ordered for a few laughs after a long day's work.

review_title: What people say are right, and I regret watching it
review_detailed_main: I never know there will be a movie like this. Worst movie I ever watch. What people say are right. I should listen to them. At least I watch this in 2020 for free 😂

review_title: Be sure to leave your brain at home when you go see this movie.
review_detailed_main:
Let's get a few things straight here... I don't watch movies like this to be moved by a deep plot line, to sweat on the edge of my chair by petrifying suspense, and to be stunned by actor's performances. I come to films like these to laugh my butt off. Nothing more, nothing less.

If you can open up your mind to the above principals of comedy films, you can truly see this film as I saw it.

This film was absolutely hilarious. Sure, the gags were often dirty, sure they were politically incorrect, sure certain people would be offended by it. But honestly, it's just a cheap comedy meant to cause people to laugh until they have heart attacks. It's what the directors intended, and in my opinion they succeeded in it very well.

So, if you can possibly lower your IQ by a few points for an hour and half, I'm sure you'll find this movie very enjoyable.

review_title: Same Old but better than the other two.
review_detailed_main:
Was it bad, yes. Is it the worst, No.

I went to see this with and I knew I wasn't going to like this, it was not good but it isn't the worst movie, I thought Epic Movie was worst.

Of course, it does drag on and on and most of the jokes aren't funny or they try way to hard. One good thing about it was Nicole Parker, I feel that she made the movie watchable. The whole story (If there was one) Was confusing and stupid. They would go on to, lets say, Juno's water braking, then, she is OK again. I know it's not meant to be taken to heart and all but it was was still not much of a movie, most of the characters got annoying and you wish they would just go off screen already! They copy movies that weren't really on DVD yet (when filming some of the movies weren't out yet). Another annoying part was when some of the characters kept repeating the line, Mcloving or whatever he says got old really fast.

On a plus side, I did like this better than the last two mistakes they did, Epic Movie was unbearable and I feel that should be lower than this. Juno and The princess are really the only ones that I liked.

Go see this if you really have nothing better to do and just want to switch off and watch a pointless movie.

(out of 10)

Acting ***** Story ** Funny rating **** Overall *****

I give it extra for the fact that I liked it better than Epic and Meet, but I won't be buying this anytime soon.

Okay, so we've had Scary Movies, Date Movie, Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans, Superhero Movie, and something called Sports Movie. Most of them have turned out to be rubbish (except Scary Movies and maybe Superhero Movie. This isn't any different to most people. I personally kinda liked it, but they use the same actors/actresses for a few different roles too much, and some bits are too long, like SabreToothAmyWinehouse burp scene and many others I can't think of. But there were some spoofs that made me laugh like Superbad. At the end there's this big song with most of the people who appeared in the movie, and I gotta admit, it's totally fantastic! It get's a 5 from me, I don't think it deserves to be the worst movie ever, Meet The Spartans was worse, much worse. And Thank you God for letting Carmen Electra in again, I love her!
This movie made me laugh all the time.Great Movie i've ever seen
This film is not only awful; it's also quite disgusting. It's so bad it doesn't even make me smile.

review_title: A really really bad movie that still has it's moments
review_detailed_main:
First I'd like to say, that if people couldn't see the star-rating before giving their own vote, this movie would likely have a better rating. This system wouldn't serve the public, but it would give a more accurate view of what people really think about the movie.

That said, I don't find this movie as bad as you might think due to the amazingly low rating. Disaster Movie is really bad and it lacks plot, but it has few funny scenes that in my books earns it 3 points. Most of the time you just watch it amazed how someone found an investor for a piece of crap like this, but the few funny parts ease the pain.

I don't recommend that you watch this, but if you feel that you must, don't even think about buying it. Even renting this movie is a bit too generous, since you'd have to give your hard earned money to the movie-people who pulled this embarrassment together. You will most likely be disappointed, maybe even angry for wasting your time, but if your friend happens to own this monster, then give it a shot. There still are way worse movies than this.

review_title: Well, at least the title of this "movie" is honest.....
review_detailed_main: "Disaster Movie" (2008), wow. As if the existence of "Epic Movie" (2007) wasn't bad enough! It seems that these "film makers" haven't learned their lesson after the first "movie". This "film", once again, has a lazy pointless story, terrible acting, cheesy special effects, dull sets/locations, and finally a cliched generic boring soundtrack to tie this diarrhea stain together. The story, or lack thereof, is just a cliched plethora of subplots with a cliched boring narrative and cliched snore fest that goes absolutely nowhere, again. Now, I do like the parody genre when it's executed properly. But, this "film" is anything but well executed! This "movie" has some of the worst direction that I have ever seen. Keep in mind, this "movie" has two directors. Yet, they still somehow screwed it up, again! How is that possible?! "Cannonball Run" franchise, eat your heart out! When I was putting my list of the top 10 worst movies I have ever seen, I was debating whether to go with this one, or "Epic Movie". By a slight margin, this one was a little better. That's not saying much! The only moment I enjoyed was the Chipmunks getting crushed at the end. I hate "Alvin and the Chipmunks"! As far as the acting goes, it is just as dreadful, as the first "film"! Most of the so-called "performances" are so bad, that it leads you to question: "what were you thinking?!" Or another question, "what kind of direction were the actors and actresses given?" As for the special effects, the majority of them look cheesy and generic. Therefore, the special effects have not aged well. The sets/locations look dull and boring, and most of the interior scenes were obviously filmed in a studio. Finally, the musical score is boring, predictable and forced. No part of the score is memorable at all. "Disaster Movie" (which it is), certainly lives up to it's title. It is, without a doubt, one of the worst movies I have ever seen, it actually was a contender for my top 10 worst movies list, but didn't quite reach the mark. Still, there is nothing positive I can salvage from this waste of film making. I'm giving this "film" 0 out of 5 stars on my scale. If I could rate it 0 stars I would, but 1 is as low as I can go. Ignore the 1 star rating, my true rating is 0 stars. The only positive thing I can gather from watching this "movie", like most other bad movies I've seen, is that I'll never have to watch it again. Stay away from "Disaster Movie", trust me, it is the epitome of a disaster!

I have good news, and I have bad news. Good news: This is the best film of the Genre Movie series. Bad news: it's still crass, stupid, and boring. The difference between it and its fellows is that even though nearly every gag in the picture has to do with bodily functions, sex, or striking men in the privates, there is an occasional moment of wit or talent in this one! Yes, folks, just as she does when needed on MADtv, Nicole Parker saves this movie from the status of atrocity to mediocrity. She should do films more often. She is just as funny on the big screen as on the small. Anyway, I cannot in good faith recommend this movie, but it's not without its moments. So, let this review guide you as you wish.

this film was so good every scene made me almost pee my pants with laughter, 10/10 loved it I will definitely be buying this DVD whenever I can I can't believe all the people who hated it I can't believe you it's amazing. It's as good as family guy. Anyone who Is thinking of watching this I say definitely do it's is funny you will probably pee your pants with laughter like I did if you don't like it don't post any mean comments or say nasty things about me because it's my opinion and not yours anyway hope you like watching it. But lots of people don't like it so you might not like it but I hope you do so enjoy and don't buy it straight away either rent it from a video store or your friends and if you do like it buy it.

review_title: This one was the best of the bunch

review_detailed_main:
'Date Movie' was good, 'Epic Movie was OK',and 'Meet the Spartans was decent.The one thing that these movies have in common is that they all received horrible,and I mean HORRIBLE,reviews.But Why?I found them a little enjoyable,even though they had scenes that really didn't belong in the first place.But 'Disaster Movie'is probably the worst film from Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.I'm not saying that I wasted money when I went to see the movie in the theater,I'm just saying that this movie had some parts that completely wasted my time.For example,there's a scene that spoofs 'High School Musical.'The one problem with that scene is that it was too long.The characters couldn't sing or dance,so they should've left the original movie by itself,or the scene could've been cut short.Overall,this is an OK movie that I would probably skip if I were you if I would be looking for a very funny movie.

C-

This movie was certainly a surprise....only to me. I watched every spoof movie that came out since Scary Movie and this one is clever and ranks near the top....with a 5/10. The Scary Movie films were much better than this movie while Meet the Spartans is possibly the worst spoof ever made.

As with most spoof movies, there is no need to describe the plot. The main storyline/spoof is based on Cloverfield. Other movies thrown into spoof mode are Indiana Jones, Iron Man, Batman, Juno, Alvin and the Chipmunks, and Hannah Montana. Almost none of these films are disaster movies, just to let you know.

There are some strong points and weak, disastrous points. The 10,000 BC and Amy Winehouse jokes sucked. The Alvin and the Chipmunks and Indiana Jones scenes are funny. I also agree with most people that the Hannah Montana scenes were annoying.

There are some great actors in here. I liked Matt Lanter and the queen of spoof movies, Carmen Electra.

There was a good effort by the makers of this film. There is not enough to warrant many laughs. I can see why over 80% of the comment writers voted a 1 for this film. I rate this film 5/10.

There seems to be a boycott going on against this movie (and the 'spoof movie' series), as the rating indicates. Granted, those movies have an old, tired formula, and they're all very similar, so I really don't know why people who don't like these kind of movies insist on watching them.

Silly jokes, vulgarity, impersonations - that's what this movie is about. It's a mindless comedy that tries to cram up as much pop-culture as they can make fun of. The plot can probably be summarized in one line. You don't really have to pay attention to this movie, and as such, I was entertained.

There were several laugh-out-loud moments here, but unfortunately this movie (like all others in this vein) suffers from over-repetition of jokes, some go on for too long and some that are not really funny.

While "Disaster Movie" isn't a comedic masterpiece, it's not nearly as bad a film as people make it out to be. I'd say it's okay. So if you don't like silliness, stay away. I had some fun, and that's what I was expecting.

review_title: They make em because people love to laugh
review_detailed_main:
I can't believe how hard reviews are for this film.First people decided that the dark knight was a masterpiece that had to be viewed 5 times at the theater and now they decided to shrink the rating of this film at below 2/10.(at least,it's where it's at as i am writing my review).

Things go in waves.One second a scary movie makes over 100 million,the other second,people snob a comedy like superhero movie. One second,meet the spartans is number one,the other second,people snob another movie spoof like disaster movie.

Disaster movie has it share of gross jokes (which i never liked but it goes with the territory) and a few jokes that don't work. But it also have situations that do make us laugh(the rub on spoof or whatever it's call is totally hilarious!)

Whatever's the case,spoofs are not dead but apparently people weren't in the mood for laughing this weekend.

review_title: Did they try and make the worse film ever?
review_detailed_main:
I've given this travesty 3 stars instead of 1 on the off chance that the creators deliberately went out to make the most annoying and unfunny film they possibly could. Kinda like a parody of a parody. In a strange way, it could be considered genius.

This isn't even a so bad it's good. It's a diabolical viewing experience. 100% deserves its lowest rated film of all time honour.

FEEL A PULL TO WATCH IT AGAIN = 0 Stars

NO NOTICEABLE PLOT HOLES = 0 Stars

The title already tells this movie is going to be awful

review_title: Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer are back with yet another comedic gem!
review_detailed_main:
First there was DATE MOVIE....then EPIC MOVIE (truly epic)......then MEET THE SPARTANS....and now, ladies and gentlemen, from the guys who brought you the aforementioned comedy classics, comes perhaps their greatest,most inventive and most hilarious work yet, "DISASTER MOVIE".

The movie Makes fun of everyone and everything from the teenage **** Hanna Montana, Money-chasing-no-talent-sell-out Will smith's drunken superhero character from "Hancock", the braindead-chickflick Sex in the city", the teenage pregnancy flick "Juno", as well as many other superhero flicks from the past year.

You would, like the other movies produced by the same people, need to have seen the movies they are making fun with, in order to find this movie even more funny. This movie is like one big laugh, you can barely catch your breath before the next thing crack you up, you would have to be extremely dull if you do not find this movie the slightest big funny. This twisted form of humor is just so great, and the way things happen in the movie is truly epic, you constantly get surprised of the makers ways of introducing stuff, you just sit back laugh and wonder how the hell did they come up with stuff like that.

VERDICT: Hilarious hilarious hilarious movie that I would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for complex and twisted humor.

10/10 and a contender for the greatest movie ever made.

I've only seen some bits of it on Comedy Central UK and Ireland (formerly known as Paramount Comedy) before. It's absolutely rubbish. It's one of the worst films of all time! It's horrendous. Besides the acting is terrible especially from the idiotic Disney princess spoof.

I just hate it!

I am never watching it again ever! I'll have to totally forget about it and move on.

Speaking of a panda costume and chipmunk puppets, they look hideous and creepy to look at.

Also speaking of its film title, it is a total disaster, indeed.

If you're reading this, don't buy it on DVD or Blu-Ray and don't attempt to waste your money on this sh-t!

Parody, a sub-genre of comedy movies, designed to mock characters from movies/TV series/celebrities etc... more or less we all know about the greatest parody movies such as those of Mel Brooks for example, but here we are talking about the duo that killed this genre, namely Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.

The film starts by parodying the disaster genre (don't respond with sarcasm, I know you're thinking it) with a famous character (honestly not who it is) burping for a minute (wow, comedy geniuses) and then continues with other useless and unfunny parodies.

I want to stop on the parody of Kung fu Panda, which traumatized me the costume of Po's character (who is actually called "Kung Fu Panda" in the movie, they didn't even inquire about the name) I found it really creepy, and then I don't even understand the point of putting in a parody of a movie they haven't even seen.

Really traumatizing 1 star out of 10.

A very awful film. A couple of good songs and that a guy being a underwear model is the only things that I found enjoyable.

But this film is crap, very crap.
I enjoyed watching the movie, but it is obvious from its name and poster that it is a terrible movie. I don't regret watching :)

review_title: even in 2008, jokes about abortion and child trafficking

review_title: The fact that aspiring actors, directors, and writers can't find work while this crap is produced is absolutely appalling.
review_detailed_main: This left me speechless......and not in a breath-taking "Shawshank Redemption" type way! I literally wanted to rip my arm off and throw it at the TV it was so bad. My husband and I made a bet with one another as to who could keep watching it the longest........the loser buying the weekend beers! I was quite happy to lose that night. I had no idea what was going on, it kept skipping from one sketch to another with no plot, no reason and NO POINT! Awful acting, awful impressions, awful film! Pretty much is what it says on the tin, A Disaster. Do not watch this movie. You'd be better off stapling your genitals to a table for an hour...it'll be less painful for you!

review_title: Is this the worst movie of all time?
review_detailed_main:
No

It's not even close really. I mean there are so many other bad movies out there. That I can safely say are way worse than this one. There was actually a few jokes in here that I actually laughed and I can safely says that's a million times better then other films I've seen.

Honestly I feel like critics and people give these movies a hard time not just this one but also all the other ones done by these people, because they take it way to seriously. I mean what do you expect? It's supposed to be bad.

I feel like it's the same people who hate movies like benchwarmers and billy madison. They all expect high art oscar worthy movies, when in reality it all just varies on different peoples humor.

review_title: Despite the reviews here, I really enjoyed this film
review_detailed_main: No, it's not a Cannes Film Festival official selection, nor will you see it on the roster of Berlin or Venice or San Sebastian, but for all you film critics you are disecting this film as if it was an art house flick, you need to lighten up! Is the movie stupidly dumb, yes...at times, is it incoherent...yup, is it offensive? if you cant appreciate the brand of humor...hmm..yeah probably, but does it do what it was meant to do? Most definitely. I laughed my ass off and I seriously did not know what to expect. Granted I laughed for a lot of different reason. First the set up and akwardness of some of the scenes, the FUNNY MOMENTS, because yes it did have some very funny moments that had me laughing out loud. But all in all I enjoyed the film for what it was. All you film critics here need to get off your high horse and sit back and see it for what it is... brainless entertainment. For me I left my baggage at the door and went for the ride. I left the theatre feeling lighter than when I went it so for me, it did do what it was set out to do.
This movie is such a terrible disaster that I wanna rate 1 star, but it's very good at being what it's supposed to be: a disaster, which could get 10 stars. So I went for 5 to be equal.

review_title: It really is a disaster movie
review_detailed_main: Worst movie I've seen ever I will never get back the time I spent watching it

This movie (and I'm being generous with the term) waste of an hour and a half of my life. I thought I was being an edgy teen going to see that movie, but walking out of that movie when it was finally over, even 13-year-old me wondered, "who on earth was this for?"

I'm honestly shocked that the team behind this movie went on to make a couple others after this one. This movie was a disaster and the title was so fitting. I suppose the one thing this movie could be useful for would be for someone looking back on the year 2008 and trying to figure out what had come out within the last year and a half or so. Most of the jokes amounted to a character appearing and announcing "hi! I'm (insert name of pop culture icon)" and then getting killed somehow. 1/10 feels generous.

Oh god, this has exceeded my expectation of this atrocity. I have been hearing so many people that not only Disaster Movie is the worst parody movie, but also among the worst movie ever made. And now I can understand how. The story is absolutely broken and has no story about the end of the world. The jokes are inconsistent and throw out nothing but pop culture references and gross out humor. The visuals are completely unfinished and some of the designs scare me. The costumes are a joke. The characters should not exist in a disaster movie like this. The acting would have to be some of the worst for a movie. And everything feels out of place. Seeing Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer made other parody movies that prove how much of the directors they turn out to be. If you ask me, this is the only movie from them I will ever watch. I'm not looking anymore of these pieces of garbage. Please, in any circumstances, do me a favor and never, I mean never watch this film. Your sanity is much more important than losing it by risking 80 minutes of cringe. If there is the one thing we can all agree on is yes, it really is that bad. It may not be an official trilogy, but I'm pretty sure this is the worst trilogy to exist. The title is the only good thing because this has came out a disaster.

review_title: Not THAT bad as it supposed to be
review_detailed_main: Well. When i saw this movie, i was thinking like "okay lets check whats on the bottom of the IMDb list." and since this one was the bottom #1 that time, i gave it a go. First of all i have to say that im not a big fan of these mindless comedies,or actually im not a fan of comedies at all. But then i took it for a watch. First i had a big facepalm about the totally mindless and stupid plot, but then it started to be somewhat funny. Im not saying that its a good movie compared to lets say American Pie series. Or any other famous comedies, but its good for a one time watch. I kinda feel the same about the Paris Hilton comedies. They got awful ratings, but they are 'OK' for one time. Watch this if your brain is totally knocked out,and you don't want anything serious.

I didn't know what to think of this movie when I first heard of it. I heard it had a notoriously low score on Rotten Tomatoes, but that was about it. I saw it on HBO and let me tell you: it's bad.

Not in the it's-so-bad-it's-good kind of way. This movie is utterly atrocious; there is no work around to it. I'm literally writhing this review as the movie plays. That's how bad it actually is. It's so unentertaining and unfunny I'm finding more joy writing an essay about it that actually watching it. It's just pop-culture reference after pop-culture reference. No piece of media is safe. It's a terrible time capsule of the late 2000s.

People literally die out of nowhere just for laughs. Jokes go on MINUTES longer than they should. No exaggeration. I started watching half way through. I'm sorry, this might be out of nowhere, but this movie does this constantly, so I'll give myself a pass on this one. But the ending credit sequence sucks. Oh my god and the cows. The movie just ended by the way. So I guess my review is done. I don't wanna give this movie anymore attention. It doesn't deserve this much attention. Good bye.

TL;DR - Movie bad. Like, BAD bad. Good bye.

review_title: An incoherent and tasteless mess, but certainly not *the* worst movie around
review_detailed_main:
I have to admit that I am not the target audience for Disaster Movie. I have not watched any other of the franchise before and probably don't know the movies it is spoofing well enough to enjoy its "jokes". The only reason I was watching it is that as of the day of writing, this occupies toe top (or bottom?) spot on the IMDB bottom 100 list. According to that ranking it beats stuff like "Manos The Hand of Fate", "Birdemic" and "Saving Christmas", so as a bad movie lover I had to see it. And right off the bat: yeah, the badness oozes right from the first minute of this one. There is incoherent storytelling, bad acting, unfunny and tasteless jokes galore and enough confusing stuff to make your head spin. And yet, this is not the worst movie there is and the reason is Nicole Parker. Even when she first appears as the gasoline gulping Amie Winehouse lookalike the scene becomes enjoyable in a weird way. And when she later reenters the scene as the enchanted princess - although her lines are as crappy or even crappier than those of the rest of the cast - she is neither embarrassed nor pompous, but she seems to be fully aware and she seems to enjoy playing this crap as much as a bad movie lover enjoys watching it.

Don't get me wrong, the movie is still a confusing mess filled with tasteless jokes but because of this exceptional performance it is not nearly the worst film I have seen.

Some guys here defend this flick, I see myself able to defend "Scary Movie 1-4" which are art in their own way... where you see people having fun and being creative

here... its just a very lazy salad of all the popular movies of that time, that being referenced only for the sake of being referenced, with nothing clever to be said or satirized

the joke is allways the same, someone getting a pan in his face, or a kick in the balls, ohhhh you know that popular character?! you know whats gonna be real funny?! him getting a kick in the balls! ha ha ha ha! thats not funny!

I give it a 2 instead of 1, only because the song at the end was the only thing that made me giggle

Billy Corgan is an American musician best known as the lead vocalist and guitarist in the alternative rock band Smashing Pumpkins.

Synopsis

Billy Corgan is an American musician born on March 17, 1967, in Elk Grove, Illinois. Raised by a blues guitarist father, in 1985 Corgan formed his own band, but it never caught on. He founded a new alternative rock band, Smashing Pumpkins, in 1989 where he was the lead vocalists and guitarist. A year later the band signed a recording contract, and in 1991 they released their debut album Gish. The band experienced success through the 1990s with albums such as Siamese Dream (1993) and Mellon Collie and the Infinite Sadness (1995), the latter of which went platinum nine times in the U.S. Smashing Pumpkins broke up in 2000, but reunited in 2006.

Early Life

Musician William Patrick Corgan, Jr., better known as Billy Corgan, was born on March 17, 1967, in Elk Grove, Illinois. Corgan was raised primarily by his father, blues guitarist Bill Corgan, Sr., and his stepmother. The young Corgan played music in high school and formed his first band, The Marked, in 1985. Even after relocating to Florida, the band never hit its stride, and a few years later Corgan found himself back in Chicago, working in a record store and scheming his next musical venture.

Forming Smashing Pumpkins

With guitarist James Iha, bassist D'Arcy Wretzky and drummer Jimmy Chamberlin, Corgan founded Smashing Pumpkins in 1989. The band??s psychedelic alternative rock ??and Corgan??s ripping guitar solos and lead vocals ??soon gained a loyal following in the Chicago club scene. Smashing Pumpkins signed with Caroline Records in 1990, and their debut album, Gish, was released the following year.

Disbanding and Reunion

In 2000, following a struggle with Chamberlin??s heroin addiction, the Pumpkins parted ways, after which Corgan and Chamberlin founded the short-lived band Zwan. After its demise, Corgan released his solo debut, TheFutureEmbrace, in June 2005. Smashing Pumpkins reunited in 2006, with Ginger Reyes on bass and Jeff Schroeder on guitar replacing Wretzky and Iha. The band played its first reunited show in May 2007 and released Zeitgeist later that summer.

It's quite astonishing how much a movie can be a complete dumpster fire when it's actively trying to be one, but I think it went even beyond what was envisioned and attempted from the very beginning. I think I can do it better than this, even without a high budget camera!"This film's plot is as delicate and absent as a fart in the wind, seriously talking about that would be more worthwhile and less of a waste of time than this awful creation. I understand that a lot of reviews are usually done cause someone liked it, didn't like it, or completely didn't understand it. This is in no way a movie that I would watch multiple times. However, people are completely misunderstanding the reason these movies are even made (Meet the spartans, date movie). The movie industry is absolute trash and even the society around these movies and what they actually believe in or stimulated by is also complete trash. These movies make fun of those movies but they do it in such a terrible terrible way that it should put into perspective how bad the original movies they are making fun of are. I wouldn't buy these movies and I sure as hell wouldn't go see it in theaters, but I give them a thumbs up for making trash portray how much trash is in the movie industry today. Keep up the cynical, facetious, and over the top anti-humor. I commend you, and I only recommend watching this in bits or if you are bored to absolute death.

review_title: A brilliant juxtaposition between amazing and awesome
review_detailed_main: I've seen Cloud Atlas...BORING...Inception? I fell asleep in the first ten minutes...Citizen Kane? Yawnarama...But, then I had the great opportunity to see this masterpiece of cinema! I thought to myself; Is this Kubrick's lost movie? Is this a collaboration between Coppola, Scorsese and Spielberg? I have never cried, laughed, was terrified, depressed, joyous or triumphant like I was, watching this movie...Throw away your DVD's , Cancel your cable, gather your friends together and bask in the wondrous, Nay, Godsent, homage to human existence. Your life will be fulfilled. That empty feeling; Gone forever...I only wish I could be lashed to a chair for eternity watching this movie~ a tear~
